Swathi Kottakota

Objective: 

To obtain a position with a progressive web development or software development company 

with a strong focus on creativity and problem solving. To support a network infrastructure based 

on multiple operating systems and complex network topologies. To find a position that is 

challenging, rewarding and provides an opportunity to expand my knowledge and abilities in 

creating client centric solutions. 

Areas of Profession: 

3 years of experience in software development. Created real-time web applications, 

complex front-end and back-end management systems including content management, e-

commerce, customer relations and communication interfaces.

Andhra Pradesh. 

Project Summary: 

Project: 1 

Project Name : Zaakit 

Role : Designing, Developing and Data base Management 

Technologies : PHP, HTML, Java script, Ajax, MySQL, and Linux 

Description : Whatever your shopping style - one-off, casual, impulsive or shopaholic,  

   Zaakit is here to make your life easier. 

Enjoy the convenience of shopping from your favorite store, for your 

favorite products and get exclusive discounts / offers from them, all right on your phone. Forget 

paper - receive all your bills directly into the app and store them for life. Pay your bills from the 

app. Analyze all your spends visually. 

Link: http://www.zaakit.com/

credentials prepared the question papers for Assessments(Exams) based on some categories. 

Candidate login in to this site with his credentials and attempt the Assessment and view the 

result. 

Link : http://eurotechworld.net/competency 

Project: 3 

Project Name : Tristar (classified) 

Role : Developing and Data base Management 

Technologies : PHP, HTML, Java script, Ajax, MySQL 

Description : This is an Application site .This site is useful for providing Fire Extinguishers 

products to Organizations. Through this site admin prepare the Quotations based on approval of 

quotations, he will prepare the Bill Invoices .what are the operations will need to prepare Bill 

Invoice for Particular Products all the operations are done at this site, Frontend also available for 

this site.  

Project: 4 

Project Name : Welding Training 

Role : Developing and Data base Management 

Technologies : PHP, HTML, Java script, Ajax, MySQL 

Description : This is a site of courses for which interested candidates can register and know 

the other details related to that. In order to attend that course they need to pay through PayPal

their mails. And to post a particular course Administrator is provided where the admin can add, 

edit or delete the courses. 

Link: http://eurotechworld.net/weldingtraining/ 

 

Project: 5

Description : This is the Ecommerce site where Banners (products) are available and also 

http://eurotechworld.net/competency

can select specific height and width and specific attributes for each banners type (i.e.) category. 

User can select the banners with required features and add to cart and make the online payment 

through PayPal or card payment and checkout the process.

SAP Consultant 	                                                                 	    	     Monish Nair
								     monishnair7@gmail.com
								     +91-9725992383									   		     +91-8980019133                 			

Career Objective:

To work and grow in an environment where performance is rewarded with new responsibilities and challenges. Looking forward to work with the team which values collaboration and mentoring skills. Prove myself to be an asset to the organization and the team by making maximum use of the resources available.  
  
Professional Summary: 
· Total work experience 4.5 Years.
· Proficient in ASAP Methodology and well versed with business process, its mapping & configuration in SAP.
· Implementation project from Initial meeting, Requirement understanding, realization, preparing business blue print, SAP PP QM overview, Finalizing scope, BPML activities, Training, UAT, Go live, Sign off & Support.
· Strong domain Knowledge of PP/QM, Supply chain in Discrete & Process industries. 
· Good in Business process mapping, configuration, user training and production supports.  
· Knowledge of SOP, DM, MRP, Back flush, ATP, REM Profile, debugging techniques.
· Master Data creation like Material Master, BOM, Work Center and Routing.
· Worked in the complex landscape in SAP with SS/MES legacy systems & interface.
· Handling day-to-day support and incident calls in PP & QM pertaining to almost six clients from different industries viz. Liquor, Tyre, Pharma, Textile, and Steel etc.      
· Implementation, Functional Testing, Test Data creation, Plant Rollouts Communication with User, Training to Peers regarding changes performed in a requirement. 
· Preparation of End user Manuals, End User Training, Conducting Testing, Training.
· Was a part of Essar initiative of providing technical knowledge to functional consultants and was nominated for the ABAP training which was held at Essar. As a result, familiar with basic ABAP which includes Basic Programming knowledge, Debugging, ALV Reports, Functional Module, RFC, BAPI, User exit, BADI, Enhancement support, Smart forms.
· Possess good knowledge with standard reports and tables in SAP PP.
· A team player having excellent verbal and written communication skills, confidence, with positive attitude and having the ability to work under pressure situations.
· Brief knowledge about SAP PP authorizations.

SAP PP/QM Consultant
Saint Gobain, Mumbai May 2017- Present

ADFORS & CERMAICS Business units

· Handling support calls related to configuration/developments & master data changes in SAP PP QM.

Implementation

Ceat Tyres/Bombay Dyeing/GHCL/FDC/Larenon industry

NTT Data, Client Essar Steels Sep-13 to Jan-16

· Involved in delivering many end to end projects related to SAP PP & analytics.

· Designed data source, Staging area & tableau output visualization.
· Interfaces Unit testing - SAP tables, Unit testing & Functional Acceptance Testing – SAP.
· Prepared Design documents, FS, project blueprint, project deliverables before implementation.

Consultant,

· Providing Backup Solutions for the existing data before the next migration activity is scheduled.
· Analysis, design and develop enhancements to existing functionality. This requires extraction of data from Relational Databases and Flat files, downloading and uploading of data to and from the System.

· Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills with ability to interact with individuals & co-ordinate independently with clients at all levels.

In modern times, transportation has become a necessity. The increase in modern technology has also increased environment concerns. Thus there is a need to develop transportation facilities that are environment friendly. Bicycle is one of the best modes of transport available as it is both eco-friendly and healthy. Bicycles we see today are mostly made from metal, making of them require different processes and machinery which in turn increase their cost. One of the best alternative materials that can be used to construct a bicycle is cardboard.

Clamp is the component which is used to support the motor in control unit section in missile to be manufactured in the requirement of BDL. Control unit section provides aerodynamic control to the missile both in yaw and pitch direction and helps to complete electrical path for warhead detonation.
3) Diploma Project
Title: Solar energy and installation of solar street light
Description:
The energy that reaches the Earth from the Sun is enormous. The total reserves of energy that is stored in all of Earth’s reserves of fossil fuels like coal, petroleum, and natural gas are matched by only 20 days of sunshine. Generating solar thermal energy involves converting energy from the sun into heat. It is through type of solar energy that we enjoy such equipment as solar heaters for indoor space, tap water, and pools. This type of solar energy is also used for drying clothes and food as well as for cooking, ventilation, and sanitation.

DB Migration, Aug’2016 to Dec’2016, Santander, UK
Migration process is transferring data from one application to a different customized application without loosing any current data and ensuring there are no functional breakdowns from entities to UI pages. 
· To analyze the source and target database functionalities and map entities module wise.
· Write Stored Procedures to retrieve source data and develop microflows to absorb data from the source and functionally transfer them to respective target entities.
· Understand the gaps and document the entire process including the advantages and back drops in using DB Connector and provide further analysis on how to handle the breakdowns and gaps during migration process. 
DB Migration using DB Replicator, Jun’2016 to Aug’2016, Santander, UK

To study the possibilities to migrate data from source application to a new customized application, to figure out the accuracy and ease in migrating data using DB Replication, a module which is specially meant for data migration.
· To extensively work on two of the modules, its entities, pages, attributes and associations.
· To connect DB Replication to the database, test connectivity and synchronize all tables.
· Map the table structures and see if data is imported or not.
· Analyse the trouble shooting and debugging possibilities using DB Replicator.
· Analyse the functional breakdowns and backdrops of DB Replicator.

· Monitor Production Nightly Batch Process, create tickets and notify the team.

· Prepare scripts for data changes and validations.

· Functional – Worked on HR, Payroll and Benefits areas.

ESL Benefits Grants, Esterline, UK, September'2013 to April'2014
Project verifies the Eligibility Enrollment Verification of employees having Share Save Plan in 4Z Plan Type and sends employee data to Watson Watt for benefit plan purposes. Adds contracts from Share Save plan that needs enrolling contract details and Flat Amount Tax data.

· To create setup pages and customize existing functionality to load employee contract details.
· Work on SQR reports and SQR inbound interfaces information in various modes.

· Create PL/SQL scripts to implement the Share Save plan Eligibility.

· Migrate project from Development to Functional environment.

UASSIST (uQuestionnaire, uSQR Analyzer, uCustomizer), March'2013 to August'2013, Esterline, UK
UQuestionnaire has a set of Questions aimed to collect all the information to initiate an upgrade project originated from various business case studies like General, Administrative, Environmental and Functional.
USQR Analyzer Lists all the SQRs that need changes with respect to table structure changes in new release of PeopleTools. It lists all changes needed in individual SQR and provides functionality to auto apply the changes. The user then decides whether changes are needed and does it manually.
UCustomizer identifies and retrofits documented as well as undocumented customizations in a Peoplesoft environment. It analyzes the changes to online objects wrt to the version change or tools upgrade.

· As primary developer, to develop fields to menus and defined keys, indexes and also table edits – used as validations performed on the record fields.

· Write PeopleCode and App Engine Programs to implement the requirements.

Labor Distribution, July'2012 to February'2013, Weyerhaeuser, USA
Weyerhaeuser migrated from Mainframe GEAC application to SAP Financials. PeopleSoft HCM application was interfacing to SAP Financials through Labor Distribution system developed as Bolt-On to GEAC application. This project is to redesign the process to integrate PeopleSoft Payroll directly to SAP Financials.
· Involved in development of new SQRs and customization of several delivered SQRs.

· Create setup and run control pages for the new SQR’s developed and create outbound interfaces.
· To migrate project from Dev to Functional and Acceptance environments.
· Prepare Technical specification documents.

Tax Updates (08C, 08D, 08E, 08F, 09A, 09B, 09C and 09D), 6 months, Weyerhaeuser, USA
Six times a year, modifications to PeopleSoft applications are submitted as Bundles/Patches.
Perform the necessary changes to all data elements and make sure that there is no functional breakdown in the process.
· To download and extract bundles, to prepare list of all 3rd party objects with customizations and document the changes for each customization found.

· To run the compare reports and develop Weyerhaeuser customizations and Functional test end to end payroll and BenAdmin process.

· Run compare reports to find the customizations, develop the customized objects and perform unit testing.

· To migrate the project to Functional environment.

· Functional test end to end Workforce Administration process and Esterline customized process.

Professional Experience

Problem Manager-Allscripts (Present)

Role Purpose: -
As a Problem Manager
· Single point of contact for one or more problems
· Responsible for Ownership and Coordination of actions of those problems
· To analyse root cause, identify Known Error and coordinating actions to fix the error.
· To review the Problem Trends and Planning and Driving Improvement Plan
· To be proactive in identifying problems, analyse and recommend Service Improvement plans with the possible solutions obtained from technical teams for department or business unit
Key Accountabilities: -
· Identifies trends and potential Problem sources (by reviewing Incident and Problem analysis)
· Prevents the replication of Problems across multiple systems
· Reviews the efficiency and effectiveness of the Problem control process
· Monitors the effectiveness of error control and makes recommendations for improvements
· Maintains inventory of problems under analysis and their current progress and status
· Follows up issues and progress with problem owners where necessary
· Updating KEDB
· Produces Problem Management reports and management information
· Coordinates meetings to resolve problems
· Prevents recurrence of issues by identifying root cause and implementing fix
· work with all internal technical teams, Service Management and external stakeholders like customer and 3rd party
· Drive all problems towards root cause identification and permanent fix
· Need to have innovative approach as problems are unique and need to use different RCA techniques
· Good Interpersonal skills and organizational skills required

Key Functional areas in Wipro
· Assisting my team manager in Managing a team of 16 with 14 frontline engineers, 2 Technical Leaders.
· Assisting in recruitment.
· Service Level Agreements for the LOB in terms of Availability, Service Continuity, Incident and Problem Management.
· Manage the team to meet and exceed the established SLA goals.
· Monitoring the overall functioning of processes, identifying improvement areas and implementing adequate measures to maximize customer satisfaction level. Project Profile #

OnBlick (RIG Enterprise Applications Pvt. Ltd.,):

OnBlick is a first of its kind application that integrates a Job Board, Activity Tracking System, professional networking and all communication tools, to completely automate your hiring and tracking process. It brings the key elements of the industry together on one platform, to simplify your overall recruitment experience.

Intelligent Search: 

Intelligent search fetches only the most suitable jobs for your profile. It extensively reduces the

Time spent on job searching by eliminating any irrelevant jobs.

Compatibility Match:

Unique compatibility algorithm evaluates the compatibility between your profile and job requirements based on 5 key parameters. This algorithm gives a complete analysis of why you match a job and where you may fall short on skills.

ATS:

Activity Tracking System (ATS) helps you track all the activities around a job search within the system, by syncing every update& action within the app. This helps you forgo the need to use & maintain different systems in their job search.
InApp Communication:

InApp Communication feature helps you communicate with the recruiters within the application using features like InApp Emailing, InApp Messaging and InApp Calling. This significantly reduces the time &effort spent on getting connected with right opportunities or right people.

GeekBot Assistant:

This AI & NLP powered GeekBot not only filters, but also communicates with recruiters to identify potential opportunities on your behalf while you are busy or away.  

Contact Manager: 

All your contacts along with your interactions (calls, chats, mails and updates) with them are automatically saved in your contact manager, so you never ever lose touch with your contacts. You can always touch base from where you left with any contact.

  

Trends

Market Trends:

Market Trends gives you a clear picture of market’s demand & supply in specific technical and functional domains. With these insights you can understand the market better and make more guided decisions for your career. 

Tech Trends:

Tech Trends identifies the trending technologies and skills for you. This helps you make better decisions in upgrading skills. 

Personal Trends:

Personal Trends gives a complete synopsis of your job applications. You can easily review the statistics of your application against the number of shortlisting and interviews you profile received.

Environment: Microsoft .Net (C#, ASP.NET 4.0), Web Services, Visual Studio 2010, SQL Server 2008, ADO.NET, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS 

Description: 

The Field Spend Capture application is developed for medical sales representatives (known as 1099) to track the on-filed expenses.

The Mobile Applications will be used by medical representatives who are the employees of Smith and nephew and he/she will be assigned to some health care providers to whom they have to advertise about their products. 

The Admin App is for the application RVPs, Managers and Sales Reps who can login to check and approve the transactions made by the reps on specific dates following the HIPPA compliance. Set of functionalities are also provided where they can assign the Healthcare Providers to the reps. 

Admins can login to the application and can perform Administrator related activities like Password changes, database updates and uploads, Favorites assignment and further activities. All these can be performed from the Admin App itself with the in-built functionalities provided.

Order Entry works seamlessly with Accounts Receivable and PageMaster Classified Pagination to provide a complete solution from ad entry through production, billing and collections.

Internet Order Entry: The process of the Online Internet Order Entry (InternetOE) designed to make it simple for the end Customer to be able to place, design, schedule, and pay for the ad they wish to order from the Lee newspaper site.

Professional Objective

To work as an IT professional for a company providing IT solutions and dealing in technical development, also seeking an opportunity to expand my responsibilities in a position that will utilize the best of my skills.

More than 5.11 years of professional experience spanning software industry. Holds strong experience as an SAP IS-U Consultant of nearly 5.5 years of experience and worked across deregulated & regulated markets. Possessing rich experience in Functional Analysis, Business Process, Systems Design, documentation, implementation to testing and Integration. Demonstrated versatility for E&U area via working in the utilities sector across Electricity and Gas industries. 
Experience Summary

· Currently working as Senior SAP ISU DM/EDM Functional Consultant with IBM India Pvt. Ltd since March 2014
· Possess overall business knowledge of Electricity and Gas utility company from Meter to Cash flow in SAP ISU. Functional knowledge of Deregulated and Regulated market of Electricity and Gas Supply.
· Having rich experience in Functional Analysis, Business Process, Technical Systems Consulting, systems design, documentation, implementation to testing and Integration.
· Worked for both electricity and gas clients
· Involved in smart metering solution for deregulated market of UK
· Good knowledge of the SAP IS-U data model, ISU DM, IDEX. 
· Involved in training & resource development to build IS-U capability for both technical & functional capabilities
· Participated in SAP IS-U/CCS implementation project.
· Associated with two-support projects, monthly new releases, Smart Release and their post go-live support.
· Have been recognized in the Manager’s Choice Award-2016 and Manger’s Choice Award-2017 program by Project Manager of NPower.

Additional SAP Skills like SAP EDM, SAP MM, SAP Work and Asset Management etc.

Organization                  IBM India Pvt. Ltd (http://www.ibm.co.in)
Duration                        March 2014 -Till date
Client                            RWE NPower-UK

Project                          ATLAS Program
Role

          Senior SAP ISU DM/IDEX/SMART Functional Consultant
Project Details:  
RWE NPower, is a leading energy company in UK, and is one of Europe’s largest companies with 6.5 million (approx) residential customer accounts and 400,000 business customers. The Retailer produces more than 10% of the electricity used in England and Wales. 

Running since 2008 with Go-Live in 2011, many capability releases are performed by B&U to add new requirements from the client which have been engineered by the market demands and regulatory requirements. The current capability release is 14C1 and has been planned for Go–Live in July 2014. 

Responsibilities/ Deliverables   
Role:  Senior SAP ISU DM/IDEX Functional Consultant
· Part of AMS Offshore Team.

· Working on new BAU developments in the monthly releases.

· Role includes preparation of Functional Specifications, testing and scripting.
· Involved in contract management

· Involved in CoS gain process, CoS loss, Home move process 

· Performed  FS delivery and review as a Meter Read consultant 
· Participated in integration testing for CoS gain scenario, CoS Loss, Home move scenario.
· Involved in Meter Reading Upload and Download Process.

· Developed Device Management Batch monitoring report which includes MRO counts, Estimation Counts based on the business rules and requirements.

· Worked on Prepayment Process including profile creation, reads stored in EDM Profile, extracted from profile etc.

· Involved in Work Order and Asset Management.

· Worked on Service Order Scheduling Process (WAM-Click Scheduling), Agent appointments etc.
· Creation of Device Category and device and synchronization of serial numbers into MDMS System.

· Dealing with MDMS and DPI systems for Meter Reading for SMART Customers.

· Writing FS to Enhance and developing new SMART Functionalities based on the business requirements.

DESCRIPTION: Online Book Store is a Web-application which enables N- no. of users to access this application. 

In this portal users can select the preferred Books-Category from the list such as (“JAVA”, “.NET”, “C”, “C++”, 

etc). After selecting from the list users can see different books related to selected category. Now they are free to 

add any book into the cart by just clicking on a button “ADD TO CART”. In case they want to remove any selected 

book from the cart, they can easily remove by just clicking on the button “REMOVE FROM CART”. After 

preparing the cart, they can proceed for the payment.

· Configuring Network Load Balancing For a SharePoint environment:
Network Load Balancing (NLB) is an optional feature in Windows Server 2008 that load balances network traffic (sent to a cluster virtual IP address) among multiple servers in an NLB cluster. NLB is particularly useful for ensuring that stateless applications, such as a Web server running Internet Information Services (IIS), are scalable by adding additional servers as the load increases. 
· Enabling Kerberos Authentication Mechanism For SharePoint environment: 
Kerberos is a secure protocol that grants authentication tickets if the client’s request to the Key Distribution Centre (KDC) contains valid user credentials and a valid Service Principal Name (SPN). Kerberos is the preferred authentication type for SharePoint because it is faster, more secure, and reduces the number of errors you can get with username and passwords than NTLM. If the SharePoint website uses external data (located on different servers than the SharePoint server itself) ex. to SQL databases through web parts the SharePoint server needs Kerberos to delegate the client credentials (the credentials are never sent over the wire, only tickets which the KDC keeps track of).

1. Agency billed receivables

2. Direct billed receivables

                        (Personal Ratemaking Warehouse) 

Role: Solution Engineer
EODS Description:
The EPAS ODS is an implementation of the Operational Data Store for the EPAS policies. The data will be extracted from the Legacy applications in the ACORD XML Format. Storing EPAS ODS data in a canonical format will allow the data model to grow and encompass the enterprise as additional systems begin to feed in their operational data. The ETL will process the data from Staging database, transform them according to CDM standards and load the data into the ODS Database tables.
Team Size: 10
Responsibilities:
· The Development of the DataStage Parallel Jobs from the provided design.

· Incorporate the Business Logic into the ETL Mapping.

· Testing and Test results documentation for the Parallel Jobs.

· Development & Testing of the Sequencer Jobs.

· Develop the parallel jobs that read data from the Legacy Mainframes, COBOL format and XML format.

PRW Description:
The Personal Ratemaking Warehouse (PRW) contains non-FFD (Fireman's Fund Direct) personal lines data in support of the following actuarial functions:

Rate filings.

Rate adequacy reports and other actuarial reports.

Personal lines projects.

Policy premium is re-rated or current leveled based on current rates and factors supplied by personal lines actuaries.  The corresponding loss experience is adjusted similarly by developing the incurred losses to ultimate (expected total payments) and then trending them (adjusted for inflation, etc.) to some common date.  The expanded premium and loss files are then made accessible to the personal lines actuaries as SAS files via a Business Intelligence tool, the PRW Access Facility (PRWAF).

Team Size: 4

CSW Description: The Collection system Workstation is used to manage billing and collection activities for delinquent receivables that are transferred to the CSW System.

 For example,   if an insurer does not pay their premium payment for their insurance policy the information on that receivable is transferred to the CSW system. The business users then use the CSW system to manage the collection efforts to try and allocate that money.

ACADEMIC PROJECT
Main Project:
Title                : “Remote GSM Mobile Phone Controlled Robotic Arm with Base Rotation, Elbow and Wrist Motion with a Functional Gripper”
· Platform: embedded systems.
Description   :This project is designed with base rotation, elbow and wrist motion with a functional gripper to hold objects. The uniqueness of this project is, this can be controlled by a mobile phone from a remote place by using the DTMF decoder and mobile head set. 
                  Now when we dial the numbers in the mobile phone from the controlling side then it automatically recognizes which number has been recorded and it follows with the corresponding next step to be taken i.e., movement of the robot. Depending on the call the DTMF decoder decodes the signal of moment in the robotic arm, Base rotation, Elbow, wrist motion along with functional gripper. The total process is controlled by the controller and its associated circuitry which makes driver circuit to drive the motor/s for movement of the robotic arm.
Mini Project    :  
· Title: “Vigilance Control Device”      
· Platform:  embedded systems
Description:   The vigilance control device is a kind of ring which would be given to loco pilots on duty. This biometric device would help to stay alert and generate warnings if they fall asleep on duty. Loco pilots are given walkie-talkie set to get in touch with station master and cabin man in case of any doubt about signal failures or any other fault in the operating system, it has come to light that most of these pilots hardly use it which often results in derailments or mishaps on tracks due to human error. This device would at least check such mishaps by keeping the pilot’s alert while on duty.

PROFESSIONAL  EXPERIENCE: 
 
Trade Compliance Analyst – Honeywell Technology from 03 Oct 2016 to till date

Roles &Responsibilities:

Scope of Position: Denied and sanctioned party Screening, Releasing blocked shipments, metrics preparation, Country of Origin (CoO) classification. 

Responsible to ensure compliance of all aspects of international export activities with both U.S. Government Regulations, and Company’s Corporate Policies and Procedures, i.e. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR), U.S. Responsible for Schedule B & Export control Classification number (ECCN) classification.

· Run daily reports in SAP GTS and SAP R3 for the blocked partners/parties, perform denied and sanctioned party screening to release them in SAP. 

· Run reports for blocked sales orders, purchase orders, outbound deliveries, analyze the reasons for blockage and assign classification or License (contact appropriate ECO for License) to release the orders.

· Classifying Country of Origin for the part numbers.

· Organize weekly calls with the site ECO’s and engineering team to follow up with them for the order blockage and make sure the License/classification is applied in SAP. 

· Working with engineering team for classification disputes and arrive at the conclusion based on fit, form and function. 

· Prepare monthly metrics for all the processes in the export compliance and send it to the director

Logical Access:

· We are supporting Engineering team where they are working for some projects and they need to access some folder or servers which is in US/Canada/UK servers.

· They will raise a request in tool called ITIM where the user’s managers will receive the approval once the manager approves it comes in our queue where we will review and approve/reject based on the scenarios.

· Citizenship of the users and PDT 27 form is required to approve the ITIM requests

· PDT – Process Document Template form is the required to formally document the export classification of the data resident in an IT environment. Once on file, the Export Compliance team can use this form as a reference for determining foreign person access to that IT environment

· PDT 27 form is usually submitted by the data owner, project manager, the manager of a foreign person, or an individual with working knowledge of the data included in the IT environment.

· Data owner is a person who owns the data stored on the IT Environment\Systems (servers, folders, group or an account) or is responsible for the IT environment, system or application.

Fulcrum Global info services LLP– (Sr. Executive)-January 2011 – September 2016
 
Job Description: Order Management and Trade Compliance (Compliance check, documentation, Country of Origin (CoO) classification and providing status for the products purchased by the customers at Juniper Networks Inc.) 
 
· Recheck customer status –embargo, RPL, and EPCI. 
· Classification Country of Origin for the part numbers.
 
· Comply with US Export laws and regulations in all decision relating to RELEASE or HOLD of products booked by Juniper customer. 
 
· Good product knowledge of Juniper’s security and networking products, encryption etc. 
· Customer and end-user background check to reconfirm “clear” status as per embargo, RPL, and EPCI norms End-use bona fide checks; risk analysis for violations or diversions Compliance with US Department of Commerce Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS) regulations. 
 
· Complete shipping documentation –export invoice, shipper’s letter of instructions, shippers export declaration, special declaration document, packing list, and other mandatory documents – and ensure that the actual contents match the contents listed therein on SAP GTS tool. 
 
· We need to re-check the Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) in an invoices and application, when movement of goods happens from one place to another. 
 
· Reconfirm end-use / end-user certification. 

· Investigate potential/actual incidents working with the BU to identify root cause, determine corrective actions, and follow up to ensure closure.
 
· Invoices will be reviewed by the QA’s that the proper procedure is followed or not. 

·   Service Level agreement is monitored through work flow tool, frequency varies Daily, Weekly  
  and Semi-monthly
· Liaise with the freight forwarder to ensure smooth shipment of goods. 
 
· Tracking the movement of the shipment to ensure that statutory laws are not breached in transit; Email helpdesk for customers who wish to know the status of their shipments. 
 
· Hand over shipment to your preferred carrier at designated cross-dock locations. 
 
· Ensure that origin and destination documentation requirements are complied with. Tallying value of part numbers with the values available.
 
· Manage documentation for return material authorization (RMA), customer service shipments and dead-on-arrival (DOA) shipments to ensure export and import compliances. 
 
· Interacting through mail with Freight Forwarders and the Juniper legal team across the world. 

· Delivery of team performance and achieve and exceed given targets on productivity, accuracy, on time
 
· Finally, the motto is to prepare error free document and send them to the requester, in a way that meets their requirements.

                                       Bangalore-560047

· Listening music

Description
     
: Our project Hospital Management System includes registration of patients, storing their details into the system and labs. Our software has the facility to give a unique id for every patient and store the details of every patient and the staff automatically. It includes a search facility to know the current status of each room. User can easily get availability of a doctor and the details of a patient using the id. The Hospital Management System can be entered using a username and password. It is accessible either by an administrator or receptionist. Only they can add data into the database. The data can be retrieved easily. The interface is very user-friendly. The data are well protected for personal use and makes the data processing very fast.

Mayo Clinic is a multi-specialty integrated healthcare delivery system, which provides medical and health, health insurance, ancillary health service, clinical research. The goal is to be able to minimize the amount of time spent for data collection and data interpretation, preparation for all the consumers. Understanding business and translating data requirements were the key aspects of this project.
				
Responsibilities 
1. Involved in reviewing business requirements and analyzing data sources form Excel, Oracle, SQL Server for design, development, testing, and production rollover of reporting and analysis projects within Tableau Desktop. 
1. Created views in Tableau Desktop those were published to internal team for review and further data analysis and customization using filters and actions. 
1. Involved in creating interactive, parameterized dashboards by extracting data from various sources using data blending and applying actions - filter, highlight and URL. 
1. Created dashboard from scratch that included drill-through, filters, Heat/Geo/Tree Maps, Pie/Bar Charts, Circle Views, Line/Area Charts, Scatter Plots and Bullet Graphs. 
1. Developed unlinked, on-demand sub reports and linked sub reports using shared variables and complex reports like cross-tab, drill down and hierarchical reports. 
1. Creating visually compelling and actionable interactive reports and dashboards. 
1. Reviewed and optimized SQL queries and edited inner, left, and right joins in Tableau Desktop by connecting live/dynamic and static datasets. 
1. Created Context filters on the existing filters and Tableau data extract to publish it in server by optimizing it to reduce the report rendering time 
1. Involved in data conversion to provide reporting capabilities as per the requirement. 
1. Performed data analysis on daily, weekly, and monthly scheduled refresh of data based on that business or system change that have happened to ensure that the developed dashboards are displaying accurate and up-to-date live data and sent those into production after editing. 
1. Validated the reports before publishing reports to Tableau server, troubleshoot Tableau reports, dashboards, etc.
1. Involved in troubleshooting and performance tuning of reports and resolving issues within Tableau Server and Reports. 
1. Participated in weekly meetings, reviews, and user group meeting as well as communicating with stakeholders and business groups.

Environment: Tableau (Desktop /Server), Oracle, SQL Server

this includes:

Qualification: 
        B.Tech (Computer Science) from Anna University. 

 

Certifications: IBM Certified System p Administrator 

 

Skills: 
Operating Systems : UNIX,LINUX-LVM,AIX 5L, AIX 6.1. 

Virtualization  : VIO 

LVM, Network  : NIM,NFS,LVM 

 

Experience Details: 

 Working as a System Administrator for IBM, Bangalore from April 2015 to till 
date.  

 

         Worked as a system Administrator in Maize Technologies from May  2012 to   

january 2015  

 

 

Projects and Roles taken up: 
 

 

 Performing network installations, configuring NIM master, creating nim 
resources, defining machines, configuring NIM clients and perform clients 

recovery by using their mksysb image, new installations, TL or ML upgrades etc.,  

 AIX BOS installation, including different installations methods such as complete 
over write, migration, preservation methods.  

 Installing new software file sets, upgrades, APARs installation, ML/TL 
upgradations etc., 



 
AIX/VIO/NIM 

 Performing file system integrity checks, fixing file systems issues by booting the 
server in maintenance mode. 

 Recovering root password, replacing failed hard disks, making disks high 
available by mirroring volume groups, logical volumes. 

 Problem diagnose using system dump – system dump configuration, generation, 
estimating dump sizes, configuring primary and secondary dump devices etc., 

Coordinating with IBM engineer to analyze this dump vmcore files. 

 Understanding of booting process, fixing booting issues, re-writing boot records, 
working with maintenance modes. 

 Working with system management interface tool (smit), going through smit logs 
etc., 

 Performing alternate disk installations and reduce down time while performing 
installations or TL/ML up gradations. 

 Configure NFS server and client and work on NFS issues if any. 

 Configuring network interfaces, aliases, interface speed, diagnose network issues 
by looking at their statistics. 

 Configuring startup daemons at system starting by configuring init tabs, creating, 
changing, and removing init tabs. 

 Configuring new devices, working with configuration manager (cfgmgr). 

 Fault network cards replacements, working with hot swappable devices such as 
hard disks, and replacing faulty hard disk for rootvg as well as user defined 

volume groups. 

 Configuring cron jobs, and working on cron logs to checking for job status. 

 Uploading file using ftp to different servers and fixing ftp issues. 

 Working on inetd.conf file configurations, enable or disabling services using this 
method. 

 Working with DNS name look ups (nslookup), ping, etc., networking 
troubleshooting tools. 

 AIX LVM – creating volume groups, logical volumes, file systems, etc., resizing 
file systems, working with mount points such as changing mount point for file 

system. 

 Migrating logical volumes,, mirroring vgs and lvs, copying logical volumes, 
export and importing volume groups.  

 Monitoring performance using topas, vmstat, sar, iostat, netstat etc.,  

 User and security management. Creating new users, giving access to file and 
directories, using chmod, chown and ACLS to give advance extended 

permissions. 

 Finding hardware and software errors using errpt and fixing these issues. 

 Asking rootvg backup using mksysb and also taking user defined volume groups 
using savevg. Recovering servers using mksysb tape or via NIM. 

 VIO configuration and clear understanding about Processing modes - Dedicated 
and Shared, Shared processors processing units from one shared processing pool, 



 
AIX/VIO/NIM 

Entitled capacity, Capped partitions, Uncapped partitions  virtual processors, and 

logical processors. 

 VIO server installation, backup configuring physical devices, mapping these to 
VIO clients. 

 Configuring Shared ether net failover (SEA) with dual VIO server setup, 
configuring multipathing shared disk for redundancy. 

 

Personal Details: 
Language Skills                 :       English, Telugu and Tamil. 

Nationality    :       Indian 

                                  
  

 


	JAGADISH G

Project1: Common wealth bank Front End (CBA Front End)               Oct 2016 - Till Date
Description:	
Common Wealth Banking Front End is a banking application used by Common Wealth Bank operators (tellers) around the globe. Using the GUI, the operators would be able to maintain customer details and perform essential banking transactions like deposit, withdrawal, transfer, etc. on accounts. The backend for the application is based on Oracle DB and the frontend connects to it.
Client:			                    Common Wealth Bank
	Technology/Framework:              Servlets, Jsp, Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring, 
					        Hibernate, Oracle.
Tools:	                                            Maven, Log4j, JUnit, SVN, JIRA
Team size:	                                5

· Played key role in the high-level design for the implementation of this application.
· Involved in DAO Layer to implement Persistence Logic, Processing Layer to implement Business Logic, Bean configurations and Dependency configurations in maven pom.xml.
· Developed Java Beans and Utility Classes for interacting with the database using JDBC.
· Configured and build Asynchronous communication with JMS services with MQ Services.

Project2: Common wealth bank Back End (CBA Back End)             Mar 2016 - Oct 2016
Description: 
The Common wealth Bank Application is migrated from the mainframe environment to Java. The Application contains Spring Batch Processing Configurations to read the data from flat files and to store data into Transactional DB and Central DB. The Flat files are providing by IBM mainframe server.

PROJECT DETAILS
Project   #1
Title


: Supply Chain Matrices (SCM)

Company

: TCS
Client

: Corporation Trust Company
Technology & Tools  
: Hive, Pig, Sqoop and Unix Shell Script
Duration

: July, 2016 to till date
Role                                        : Hadoop Developer
Description:     
                                  Supply Chain measurements or metrics such as Inventory Turns, Cycle Time, DPMO and Fill Rate are used to track Supply Chain performance. Commonly used by Supply Chain Management, metrics can helps to understand how company is operating over a given period of time. Supply Chain Measurements can cover many areas including Procurement, Production, Distribution, Warehousing, Inventory, Transportation, Customer Service - any area of the supply chain. However, a good performance in one part of the Supply Chain is not sufficient. The solution is to focus on the key metrics in each area. Metric is used by end client to estimate the performance of stores and Distribution center. We converted these ETL jobs into a flow of pig scripts. Finally the output of the pig scripts are stored into a partitioned and optimized hive table. Created a shell script which executes every day and creates the output file of metrics on daily basis. Congnos BI tool is used to create report from hive tables according the users defined parameters.
Roles and Responsibilities:

· Gathered the business requirements from the Business Partners and Subject Matter Experts 
· Worked on a live 63 nodes Hadoop cluster running Hortonworks Distribution.
· Compression techniques applied on data in Hadoop for optimum storage and as per required performance
· Converted Abnitio’s ETL jobs to a sequence of Pig scripts.
· Created Design Documents for the requirements.
· Developed Hive (version 2.1.1) scripts for end user / analyst requirements to perform ad hoc analysis
· Created External/ Managed Hive tables with optimized partitioning and bucketing.
· Solved performance issues in Hive with understanding of Joins, Group and aggregation and how does it translate to Map Reduce jobs.
· Experience in using best and optimized techniques for Data Definition of hive tables.
· Developed Shell Scripts for scheduling and orchestrating the pig and hive scripts.
· Written and executed test plans for validating the results of Hadoop jobs.
· Written deployment plans for moving code from development cluster to production cluster.
 Project   #2
Title


: Data Analysis-Web Intelligence.
Company

: TCS
Client

: Xoom Money Transfer.
Technology & Tools  
: Hive, Pig, Sqoop and Flume
Duration

: Aug, 2015 to July, 2016
Role                                        : Hadoop Developer
Description:  
                              The purpose of the project is to store terabyte’s log of information generated by the ecommerce website and extract meaning information out of it. The solution is based on the open source Big Data software Hadoop. To store and analyze terabytes of the data (log information), processing the data and extract various. Reports for continual
Improvement of the business to the client. The solution is based on open source Big Data software Hadoop. Data is stored on HDFS and processed with Hadoop ecosystem components.
Roles and Responsibilities:

· Gathered the business requirements
· Developing PIG scripts for processing the raw data in HDFS.
· Creating tables in HIVE for storing the processed data.
· Involved in managing and reviewing Hadoop log files
· Developed sqoop scripts for having and interaction between PIG and MySql DB.
· Developing the shell scripts for creating reports from HIVE table data.
· Written HQL and PIG script for structured data.
· Involved in create Hive External table to store the processed data.
· To write Hive queries to transform the data.
· Involved in the customer Interaction and Review.
Project   #3 (Proof of Concepts)
Title


: Retail Data Proccessing (POC) 
Company

: TCS
Environment  
: HDFS, SQOOP, Pig, HIVE, MySQL
Duration

: May, 2015 to Aug, 2015
Role                                        : Hadoop Developer
Team Size

: 4
Description:  
                  Input data was provided in Excel and PDF formats. MapReduce code was used to read the entire input data to HDFS. Data was filtered based on the criteria :  Type of trading, Opening Balance & Closing Balance. Unique Data has been maintained and sorted out based on Retail ID. Output exported from HDFS to MySQL using SQOOP. Finally, a Dash Board 
Solution(Spring Framework) used to see the results in a reporting manner. Pig output has been stored in Hive External Table.
Roles and Responsibilities:
· Proactively involved and contributed in every stage of the project
· Implemented code optimization techniques and best practices
· Gained good exposure to different basic components of  Hadoop
Project #4
Title


: Napier Patient Portal
Company

: Ness Technologies Pvt ltd
Client

: Napier Health Care Systems, Singapore
Technology & Tools  
: Spring MVC, Spring JDBC, Oracle 10g, Eclipse
Duration

: March, 2013 to April, 2015
Role                                        : Developer
Description:  
                              Napier Patient Portal is a three-tier architecture based web application that covers all departments of a hospital and automates various functionalities of each department and integrates them. One track in this project aims at implementing health care services. It allows the patients to take online appointment and also to capture their details.
Roles and Responsibilities:

· Involved in gathering business requirements 
· Worked on the user interface
· Worked on the GUI using Spring MVC framework
· Played a pivotal role in User Interface Designing
· Developed DAOs using Spring-JDBC
· Implemented ORM applications using Hibernate and integrated with Spring
· Involved in code reviews and implemented industry best practices
Project #5
Title


: Galaxy – Refactoring
Company

: Ness Technologies Pvt ltd
Client


: TAFE
Environment

: SQL, UNIX
Technology & Tools
: SQL
Duration

: May, 2013 to March, 2014
Role


: Developer
Project Description:
             GALAXY is the global Referential system, providing static data information as well as market data like price for most of the GIBD (Global Investment Banking Division) and DEAI (Derivatives action and  index) Information  Systems, in the SG Corporate and Investment Bank. Galaxy will get the data from the REUTERS, BLOOMBERG and will be consolidated those data then creates the golden copy of the data which is send to back office like BDR. The sponsor of this project is Risk Referential Finance.

Academic Project (Mini project)

Project: CANTEEN MANAGEMANT

DESCRIPTION: 
In this project, develop a software that is helpful for a canteen. By using this 
software the canteen can store the details of the regular customers and also the details of the food items they provide. And also can store the payment by the customers, list and price of each food item. The customer details include their name, which food item they buying and the price of the corresponding. And this program is developed in Java as frontend, SQL server as backend. It worked in a stand-alone machine compatible.


Academic Project (Main project)
Project:  CLIENT SERVER NETWORK IMPLIMENTATION WITH WI-FI
DESCRIPTION: 
In this project we were implemented a WLAN for this project. A network, in addition to special hardware, also requires special software to enable communications. Network support is built into all major operating systems, including all current versions of Windows. Then we will earn about the PC case and how to install computer components like the main board, processor, memory, power supply, interface boards and drives. Even though the computer may work when we are finished, it’s critical that we follow the assembly instructions precisely. Only then is the assembly considered complete and correct.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION
Faster Payments Service (FPS)
Faster Payments Service (FPS) is a UK banking initiative to reduce payment times between different banks' customer accounts from three working days using the long-established BACS system, to typically a few that day) for 'high value' transactions, while FPS is focused on the much larger number of smaller payments, subject to limits that depend on the individual banks, with some allowing Faster Payments of up to £250,000.[1] Transfer time, while expected to be short, is not guaranteed; nor is it guaranteed that the receiving institution will immediately credit the payee's account hours. CHAPS already provides limited faster-than-BACS service (by close of business)

PRIME BROKERAGE
This comprises of multiple applications which are collectively designed to produce number of trade reports and extracts for various clients all over the world. Support responsibility starts from booking a trade to the final report generation. This is established through the ITRS and Autosys. Few applications are(SFS,SFR,EDGE,FUSION,ALPS,IPB,GP,FE,FIPB,CA,CFR,PFR,AH,REF DATA,WIRES etc.)
CITI Prime Finance Swaps
The purpose of swap product is to offer clients all the benefits of holding trading portfolio without them having to purchase or own any actual stock. Trades are input into upstream system -Colt and then fed (via IPB – International Prime Brokerage) to PFS. These trades are then converted into swap trades. Swap details are then fed, in the batch, to the Swap database where the Actuate reports are generated from. The Actuate reports are configured to take data from the IPB Repository and not the consolidated database thus updates can be made to the data during intraday and there ports regenerated - there is currently no functionality to produce reports for prior business dates however, this is currently being developed. Swap trades are also fed to downstream database – Prime Broker DB for inclusion in the feed to system –Sea mans to allow for margining.
CITI Prime Finance (CPM & MERIT)
Cross Product Margin (CPM) & Multi Entity Risk Integration Tool (MERIT) used for determining the VAR (Value at Risk) in Trading level as well as portfolio level on daily basis. This VAR calculation targets the Hedge Funds. MERIT & CPM receives feeds from different system like foreign currency (FX), mortgage details, and daily trade details. These feeds are given as input to Risk Calculation Engine which is in CPM. It will give VAR reports on Trade level and portfolio level. This reports used for calculating the margins.
Citi Agency/Security lendingi
 Securities lending refers to the lending of securities by one party to another. The terms of the loan will be governed by a ", Securities Lending Agreement& quot, which requires that the borrower provides the lender with collateral, in the form of cash or non-cash securities, of value equal to or greater than the loaned securities plus agreed upon margin. Non-cash refers to the subset of collateral that is not pure cash, including equities, government bonds, convertible bonds, corporate bonds, and other products. The agreement is a contract enforceable under relevant Citi law, which is often specified in the agreement. As payment for the loan, the parties negotiate a fee, quoted as an annualized percentage of the value of the loaned securities. If the agreed form of collateral is cash, then the fee may be quoted as a ", short rebate& quot , meaning that the lender will earn all of the interest which accrues on the cash collateral, and will ", rebate& quot, an agreed rate of interest to the borrower. Key lenders of securities include mutual funds, insurance companies, pension plans and other large investment portfolios Securities Lending is legal and clearly regulated in most of the world's major securities markets. Most markets mandate that the borrowing of securities be conducted only for specifically permitted purposes, which generally include;
· To facilitate settlement of a trade,
· To facilitate delivery of a short sale,
· To finance the security, or
· To facilitate a loan to another borrower who is motivated by one of these permitted purposes.
When a security is loaned, the title of the security transfers to the borrower. This means that the borrower has the advantages of holding the security, as they become the full legal and beneficial owner of it. Specifically, the borrower will receive all coupon and/or dividend payments, and any other rights such as voting rights. In most cases, these dividends or coupons must be passed back to the lender in the form of what is referred to as a& quot, manufactured dividend & quot.  The initial driver for the securities lending business was to cover settlement failure. If one party fails to deliver stock to you it can mean that you are unable to deliver stock that you have already sold to another party. In order to avoid the costs and penalties that can arise from settlement failure, stock could be borrowed at a fee, and delivered to the second party. When your initial stock finally arrived (or was obtained from another source) lender would receive back the same number of shares in the security they lent. The principal reason for borrowing a security is to cover a short position. As you are obliged to deliver the security, you will have to borrow it. At the end of the agreement you will have to return an equivalent security to the lender. Equivalent in this context means fungible, i.e. the securities have to be completely interchangeable.

Zip Industries is a privately owned, proudly Australian business that has been manufacturing and marketing Australian designed and made instant water systems since 1947. This system is a fully-featured and completely customizable Accounting solution, featuring Order Tracking, Inventory POS, and more. It features a full People Management module. Within this module, companies can keep track of customer sales, create customer profiles and notes, include Employee Time Tracking, and other key people management applications.  Payables module consists of reports, vendor bills, track credit card purchases, and check the status of payments. The billing application creates an easy way to pay bills, request quotes, track payment history, and keep track of inventory items.

Project Summary:
                     Paramount Insurance Company one of major insurance company in Maryland   and The District of Columbia. The Paramount Insurance Company has been in the automobile insurance industry. Ez*Insure is a workflow-driven Insurance system designed to meet the growing and dynamically changing needs of the Insurance industry.  It has four modules namely Admin, Underwriting, Claims, Finance & Reinsurance. Admin module includes business   rule definitions for all modules, creation of users and their roles. Underwriting module contains creating quotes, policies and endorsements to the customers. Claims module contains registering FNOL, converting to claim, reserve allocation and claim settlement. Finance module handles all the monetary transactions in underwriting and claims modules.

Responsibilities:
· Coding of various Struts and Hibernate framework configuration files.
· Developing Action classes in Struts and POJO classes.
· Developing Persistence Logic using Hibernate.
· Developing of Jsps and also worked on Ajax and JavaScript.
· Responsible for carrying Unit Testing

Project                       	: DTPO
Client                                 : DURATread         
Duration                            : Dec 2015 to Aug 2016.                         
Environment     : Spring, Hibernate 3.6, Oracle 10g, JDK 1.6, Maven 3.0, Eclipse,                                                  Junit,Weblogic.    
Project Summary:
             DURATread is one of the major tires manufacturing company in the world located in Panama having customers from different countries. DURATread will manufacture tires of different types of vehicles in different sectors like Mining, OTR, Port, Industrial, Agricultural, Truck and Bus tires. This application will facilitate to the customers and employees of DURATread. This application will be mainly used for Registration, Order placement, Order Processing, Maintaining Transportation, Payment and Reporting.

· Responsible for carrying Unit Testing.

Project Summary:
              Living in style shopping network is a Intranet based project which provides the facility to place the order by the customer representative through online. Order page contains four parts like, Customer Information, Product Information, Shopping Cart, and Payment Information. Executive can find the product by making search and he can select product, which has to be added with shopping cart. In shopping cart sizing price, shipping and handling, unit tax for the product, unit price and Total price will be calculated. If the Payment type is Credit card then payment gateway process will be progressed.

Responsibilities:
· Designed JSP`s as per the Requirement.
· Implemented Hibernate POJO’s and DAO’s.
· Written Java Script Functions as per the Requirement 
· Involved in Unit-testing using Junit.

· Initiated ‘fun at work’, periodical seminars / meetings, cultural activities & celebrations as part of employee engagement activities.

TOOL DESCRIPTION: -

SUMMIT – The Intelligent ITSM Platform provides a comprehensive cross-module solution that helps reduce the cost and complexity in managing your IT environment. Delivered as SAAS over Cloud or SAAS on premises, SUMMIT is an easy-to-implement, easy-to-use solution that provides tight integration across key IT operations, delivering higher efficiency in the form of increased productivity, optimum asset utilization, higher compliance, reduced downtime and complete control on critical IT projects.
This unifies different modules of ITIL into a single suit, such as Service Management, Asset Management, Availability Management, Project Management, Change Management and E-Procurement.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: -

· Provide service to the customers.
· Used our own Summit tool for ticketing.
· Here we interact with the customers on daily basis to find and provide resolution to their issues.
· Addressing the issues raised by the customers and providing relevant information to them as needed.
· Writing SQL queries to generate various ad-hoc reports as per customers’ requirement.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: -
MBS - Microsoft business solution, we usually sell ERP products to Partner and Customers.

MBS Application is developed in dot net and backend as SQL Server 2012, having always on and clustering as high availability with two data centres.

Partners will sign agreements in order to get authorized and sell the ERP products and they need to certified (relevant exams on products) to sell the product.

Partners will get discounts on their products depending upon their eligibility criteria i.e. if their sales meet minimum revenue of 35K per annum.

MBS has mainly 3 portals: Partner Source, Customer Source and Partner Source Business Center.

Partner Source and PSBC is meant for Partners and Customer Source is used by the Customers.

We have SCOM to monitor the application and ticketing tool as SNOW to work on partner’s query.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: -
· The project was transitioned from Infy to Unisys and I was a part of transition.
· I was hired as a Spoc for this Application and I trained my sub-ordinates and set up the team.

· Generating various data reports using SQL/Advanced queries.
· Managing production data using SQL.
· Performing insert and update for new user set ups.

· Writing SQL queries to generate various ad-hoc reports as per client requirement.

· Provide technical assistance for associating Partners/Customers as needed during their analysis of billing data.

· Here we interact with the users (Partners, Customers and other users) on daily basis to find and provide resolution to their issues.
· Preparing, updating and uploading Knowledge Transfer documents in the project share point folders.

· Addressing the issues raised by the users and providing relevant information to them as needed.

· Providing KT to the newly hired Analysts.

· Mentored junior resources in the team creating awareness on project specific applications and company standards.

· Application related process monitoring and troubleshooting.
· Participate & Co-ordinate in various server & application Functionality upgrades.

· Analyzing faults in the system and providing solutions in the agreed SLA timings.

· Conduct huddle meetings on daily/weekly basis.

· Providing 24*7 supports to ensure the application and resources available at all time as per availability management.

· Earlier used ITSM as a ticketing tool and recently switched to SNOW (Services NOW) ticketing tool.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: -
GRCM is a combination of 4 to 5 applications which work together to help analyst from investment bank to perform their analysis on global stock market and distribute it to clients all over the world.
Following are the component applications.

1) Coverage – is application/Database which maintains all static data needed for research, like Analyst details, stock details, and research report subscription details.

2)  RSM – Research Subscription Management module.

This is application which is used for assigning subscriptions to clients; this uses the database of coverage.

Here Operations team can set up a new client, and subscribe a new research as per his request.

Following are types of research subscription.

-Analyst Subscriptions – where client subscribes to particular analyst which he/she is interested.

-Periodical subscriptions – Here client subscribes to particular periodical published by bank.

-Region/country subscriptions – Here client can subscribe to particular region/country research which he is interested.

-Sectors Subscriptions – Here client can subscribe to particular sector like oil and gas, IT, Metals and gold, banking. So client will receive all research published on that sector.

3) GRCM – GRCM is front end application, which analyst will use to create a research.

Analysts can create research reports, check-in and checkout, status of the research reports and authorized approvals for writing, publishing those reports.

4) GDP – Global Distribution Platform – this module takes care of distribution of research.

-Once research is approved GDP distributes the research document, based on subscription for that research the client will receive the hard copy or the soft copy of the research document

on daily/weekly/monthly basis.

5) R1 Database: It manages all stock related financial information regarding all stocks.

Like financial numbers, forecasted data, historical data. This numbers are tagged to the particular stock tagged to the research.

PROJECT-2:

DB-FMS -> FINANCIAL MESSAGING STRATEGY
Client

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: -
FMS -> Financial Messaging System is software application within DB, responsible for the successful implementation of the new financial messaging solution. GTX (Global Technology Exchange) concept which is the bottom-line product that handles most of the deutsche bank’s SWIFT FIN traffic. GTX supports multiple networks like SWIFT, SIC, Telex, Fax, Email. It provides a single window access to all of the SWIFT services (FIN, RMA, File ACT, InterACT). GTX can be called as backbone of FMS application, which connects all the backend channels through multi-connectors and delivers web services to external applications in the context of service oriented architecture (SOA).
SWIFT- Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication is a network established to have common standards for financial transactions and a shared data processing system.

The main components of FMS application are:
CBT - Computer Based Terminal, message validation takes place and gets distributed to different nodes.
NPI - Network processing Integration, inbound/outbound messages are processed.

GT Bridge - is a layer through which the messages are flown from CBT/NPI as well as to the backend channels. This layer is responsible for delivery/failure of messages.
OMS - Output Management System, a DB developed product which handles all printing/emails.

Message types:

MT940 - regular basis statement.

MT942 - interim statement sent to the customer on their request.
MT950 – statements sent directly to the customer.

Coming to the application architecture, FMS uses the Resilience concept (Cross configuration), 2 decoupled active instances that replicate their data to the other side. This concept justifies that a failure of one instance does not harm continuous processing of the remaining instance.

Project Name		:	BSNL GPRS – Telecom
Client			:	BSNL India 
Duration		:	January 2016 to August 2017
Role			:	Database Developer & Analyst
Environment		:	SQL Server 2012, My SQL 5x.
Description:
The GPRS core network is the central part of the General Packet Radio Service which allows 2G, 3G and WCDMA mobile networks to transmit IP packets to external networks such as the Internet. The GPRS system is an integrated part of the GSM network switching subsystem. We are responsible to accept the customer’s Activation & Deactivation request and has to enable the service in respective nodes. GPRS, SMS, VOICE service Activation & Deactivation will be notified with a request through different modes.


Project#2
Project Name		:	RRBT, Bakwata & Halotel - Telecom
Client			:	RRBT, Bakwata & Halotel networks - Africa. 
Duration		:	January 2016 to August 2017
Role			:	Database Developer & Analyst
Environment		:	SQL Server 2012
Description:
The RRBT, Bakwata and Halotel are the telecom networks in Africa. Here campaign names will be created by business team and after pushing campaigns we need to capture the success count and submit count and calculate the revenue for the each MSISDN.

Project#3
Project Name		:	Etisalat - Telecom
Client			:	9Mobile-Nizeria. 
Duration		:	August 2017 to November 2017
Role			:	MIS Analyst & Developer
Environment		:	SQL Server 2012, My SQL 5x.
Description:
The former name of 9mobile was Etisalat, recently it was changed to new name called 9mobile. TPS (transactions per second), a measurement used to determine how many transactions have been processed in one second in transaction-oriented systems.
Here, campaigns will be created to send the SMS to the customers and each campaign name will be having its own campaign id and campaign name. Based on this campaign id’s SMS will be pushed to customers.
Based on above scenario, we need to capture the base count, total SMS push count, successfully delivered count, failed delivered count.

	PROJECT UNDERTAKEN


 
           Bhalu GUI library provides simple reusable Java classes through which we can generate required SVG code for presenting a reusable and replaceable GUI components. Any large data driven application contains many large GUI components and the GUI components in the application need to collaborate with each other. To collaborate with each other, each of the GUI components in the application need to communicate with each other. The main objective of Bhalu is to help even junior java application developers for developing complex data driven GUI applications. Bhalu requires just few lines to instantiate and initialize each of the java object for presenting a GUI component. Bhalu requires about 2 to 3 lines of code for creating communication code between any two GUI components in the application.

  Project Brief: 
· This alarm saves both time and electricity for students. It helps to prevent them from dozing off while studying, by sounding a beep at a fixed time interval, say, 30 minutes.
· If the student is awake during the beep, he can reset the circuit to beep in the next 30 minutes. At its most basic level, ERP integrates these processes into a single system. But new ERP systems are anything but basic. They provide visibility, analytics, and efficiency across every aspect of a business. Using the latest technologies, ERP systems facilitate the flow of real-time information across departments, so businesses can make data-driven decisions and manage performance

Professional summary:
· Extensive experience in installation, administration and maintenance of MS SQL Server 2012/2008R2/2008/2005 versions.
· Experience in Installation, Configuration, Upgrade and Patch management of MS SQL Server.
· Experience in Database Backup, Recovery.
· Performing periodical backups and restoring them when required.
· Monitoring space on server, handling issues with Log files, Shrinking Log and Data files.
· Monitoring high availability features such as Log Shipping, Mirroring, and Clustering.
· Managing Database Security by creating users, logins and by assigning roles and permissions.
· Migration of databases between the servers and Performed Database Refreshes.
· Configuring, Scheduling and administering Jobs, Tasks and Maintenance Plans.
· Good experience in resolving blocking Issues by using DBCC commands.
· Experience in performing Weekly and Monthly Health checks for SQL Servers and Databases.
· Experience in interacting effectively with clients.
· Self-motivated, quick learner and interest to learn new concepts and technologies.
· Providing 24/7 support
· Installing and Uninstalling patrol on all the Windows and Linux Servers.
· Creating tickets through SAP CRM tool.
· Monitoring alerts in Active Monitoring tool.
· Provide 24x7 supports for critical production systems.
· Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes.
· Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time.
Experience Summary:
· Total 1.5 Years of IT Experience in Database administration - MS SQL Server.
· Working as a Database Administrator in NTT DATA GLOBAL DELIVERY SERVICES Pvt Ltd, Bangalore.

TECHNICAL SKILLS
RDBMS:                                         MS SQL Server 2000/2005/2008/R2/2012.
Database Tools:                           Manager, Management Studio.
Backup and Restore Platforms: Windows 2000/2003/2008

Project Summary: #1

Client:            McKesson Health Care.
Duration:       Nov 2016-TILL DATE.
Role:                Team Member
Team Size:      9
Environment: SQL server 2005/2008/2008R2/2012.
Description:
McKesson Provider Technologies is a healthcare IT company, dedicated to delivering comprehensive solutions with the power to make a difference in how you provide healthcare. Our capabilities extend beyond healthcare IT software to include automation and robotics, business process re-engineering, analytics, and other services that connect healthcare providers, physicians, payers and patients across all care settings



Roles & Responsibilities

· Providing 24/7 On-Call support for critical production databases.
· Installation, Configuration and Administration of SQL Server 2000/2005/2008/R2/2012.
· Working on Standard Database Maintenance tasks, Backups and Recovery Plans.
· Database Refreshes from Production to Stage and Development environments as per the requirement.
· Performing SQL server daily health check and preparing a report based on it.
· Monitoring Disk Space of all the Servers and freeing up space as per SQL Server i.e. Older Backups, Unused Files etc.
· Handling creation of new SQL Server databases as per Client/Application Team request using Build Sheet Template.
· Scheduled and maintain Jobs, Alerts and Maintenance Plans.
· Managing backups on a daily basis and recovery (as per request).
· Script Execution and revert the results to the user
· Working as part of a team and provide 24x7 technical database support.
· Administration of SQL server by creating user Logins with appropriate roles, granting and denying login privileges, monitor the user accounts, creation of groups, granting database and application roles to users and groups.
· Periodic checking of databases with DBCC command for maintaining data consistency and integrity and rebuilt indexes.
· Constantly checking functionality of the environment and taking necessary action when an alert is thrown from alerting mechanism by taking a prompt action based on its severity and considering the resolution of the issues as most primitive tasks. 
· Carrying out Installations and upgradations of SQL server Database engine and client tools through all the versions and administrating the same.
· Reviewing SQL Server and SQL Server Agent Error Logs.
· Knowledge on high availability methodologies. 
· Applying SQL Server patches and Service Packs, monthly Reboot activities during the maintenance window.
· Raising Change requests for any production change to be made and other defined requests for their respective purpose.
· Creating Weekly and Monthly analysis reports for the Database Growth and Performance statistics
· Monitoring Active Monitoring and BMC Alerts.
· Update Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), if there is any change 
· Distribution of Knowledge with in Team considering any new issue and document it for future usage if it surfaces back.
