Praveen Thomas

Contact: +91 725 980 5627 - 					Email: praveentom@outlook.com / praveentom@gmail.com

 Skilled in leading my teams to handle the entire employee life cycle activities, from a strategic and an operational perspective spread across multiple GEO locations.

· Seasoned HR professional with over a decade of rich and demonstrated experience in leading and managing the entire gamut of HR functions - Compensation & Benefits, Talent Acquisition, Training and Development, Performance Management, HR Operations & Quality, HR Analytics, Best Practices, Payroll, Backend Operations, Rewards & Recognition, Statutory Compliances, etc. in the Telecom, Engineering Services, Manufacturing, IT Products & Services Industry.
· Been instrumental in organically growing organizations up to 700% in capacity.
· Experienced in setting up new HR practices, process and policies in startup organizations or revamping redundant processes in existing setups with lean 6 Σ practices to meet strategic business expectations.
· Founded a HR consulting organization and also ventured into 5 separate ventures, wealth security, a home tutor aggregator, WhatsApp advertising and also into stock market advisory.
· Ability to review legal agreements, strong working knowledge of employment laws, familiarity with best HR practices in the industry, ability to problem solve and generate effective and pragmatic solutions to complex situations as helps me play the role of a standby corporate legal advisor too.





KEY HIGHLIGHTS & ACCOMPISHMENTS 

· Successfully implemented in-house developed online tools to analyze and reduce recruitment cycle time and also improve vendor / partner effectiveness.
· Successful in coming up with innovative methods to ensure over 87% onboarding of offered candidates (increased onboarding from 45% to 87% in just 3 months).
· Successfully benchmarked, redesigned and implemented the Compensation & Rewards structure in the organization which included Salary, Flexi, Variable pay, Incentives, Bonus, Long Term Benefits etc.
· Successfully handled Industrial Relations for manufacturing plants in Kolkata for 2 yrs (2008 ~ 2010).
· Successfully implemented an effective system of Technical Training Need identification, Trainer evaluation, Training delivery, evaluation, widely appreciated by all business leaders in the organization.
· Successfully made the Technology center at Hyderabad, a Centre of Excellence (COE) for HR Analytics (Business Intelligence) and Shared Services across Indian branch locations.
· Successfully designed and implemented Reward and Recognition programs.
· Certified Green Belt.
· Certified in DISC Thomas Assessment.
· Successfully implemented a continuation of services program for employees (gratuity scheme) who were travelling on long term to other Countries.
· Awarded with the multiple Extra Miler awards for taking in additional responsibility in pitching as the temporary replacement to the country HR head and also in another case in ensuring completion of a critical compensation project for the entire country.


PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

HR Partner, Offline HR Pvt. Ltd. (HR), ● Bangalore, Jan 2016 ~ Till Date
General Manager - HR, Jenesys Technologies Pvt. Ltd. (IT), ● Bangalore, Dec 2013 ~ Jan 2016
Sr. Manager - Human Resources, Regal Beloit Corporation (IT, ITES, Mfg.), ● GE Motors - Hyderabad, Marathon - Kolkata, Marathon - Faridabad, Marathon – Hyderabad, May 2006 ~ Oct 2013
Generalist - Human Resources, Lucent Technologies (Telecom), ● Bangalore, Mumbai, Jul 2004 ~ Apr 2006


SKILLS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS & RESPONSBILITIES

Compensation & Benefits Management
· Demonstrated strong project management skills while involved in multiple benchmarking sessions right from job description - analysis - evaluation - survey participation - mapping - benchmarking - range - salary increase - communication - release of letters - implementations for our Indian Locations with multiple Business Leaders based on internal and external equity.
· Was responsible in implementing the annual compensation benchmark surveys according to the compensation philosophies of the company.
· Handled the HR Budget and corresponding MIS reporting to the corporate annually.
· Played a key role in formulation & implementation of increment, incentive & other remuneration policies.
· Managed the appraisal process across the levels and establishing framework for substantiating Performance Appraisal system linked to Reward Management.
· Worked with Business Leaders and corporate on Performance Appraisals, Annual Revisions and Promotional increases.
· Successfully revised and implemented benefits medical insurance, life insurance, accident Insurance, car lease and other benefits to have the same aligned and harmonized across all our branch locations across the country.

Employee Engagement, Planning & Execution
· Expert in implementing and managing the entire gamut of HR in SMB sector and captive units.
· Had been leader for maximizing savings on the SGA front and also the smooth operation of the company’s Human Resources Department.
· Been the advisory member to management on future strategic staffing plans, compensation impacts, competitive benefits, training and development, budget savings, and smooth employee relations.
· Responsible for making strategic decisions on the HR front while defining effective SLA’s and TAT’s of teams based on the policy deployment of the organization.
· Plan, design, develop and evaluate human resource-related initiatives that support organizational goals and also improve employee engagement.
· Initiated a social welfare group “SPARSH” with various employee led fun and CSR activities 
· Initiated focused groups to engage employees and to enable themselves to identify winners across the teams for the “Wall of Fame” quarterly.

Talent Acquisition
· Lead my team on the complete recruitment life-cycle until delivery by enabling my team source the best talent at all levels from diverse cost effective sources.
· Conceptualized and implemented Recruitment Score cards and Dashboards, thereby giving visibility to hiring costs and sourcing right talent at the right times and highly reducing recruitment cycle time.
· Advance planning manpower requirements in consultation with business heads of different functional & operational teams.
· Empowering my team on improvising the induction programs, effective contract negotiations, revising policy & procedures, etc.

Training & Development
· Streamlined the training process, development of Skill Matrix, improving employee’s competency level through in-house training and best practice sharing.
· Promoted a high performance culture by identifying key competencies and skills required across levels, Gap identification and develop strategies to bridge the gap.
· Developed tools for training impact assessment and trainer efficiency evaluation.
· Help my team identify and tie up with vendors to deliver specialized training programs as per the Training Need Analysis and Training calendar.
· Identification of next level leaders, resources with key and critical roles across the organization and implemented strategic succession planning tools, thereby ensuring smooth transition during leadership churn.

Performance Management
· Have been the lead for the overall performance management annually in the organizations as per norms.
· Responsible for addressing employee development needs based on the skill matrix and competency model.
· Successfully revamped the Performance Review discussions with greater thrust on openness, specific feedback, detailed documentation, midterm reviews and focus on skill gap.
· Successfully developed initiatives on Employee Development and Succession Planning.
· Implemented a digitized tool for Performance Improvement Plan for employees rated Needs Improvement.

HR Operations
· Responsible for ensuring all policies and procedures are up to date and legally compliant, maintain a succession plan for all departments and develop a culture that enables employees to perform as per the company’s objectives.
· Lead my team in managing the employee orientation and training programs, benefits plan, policies and guidelines, employee database management & documentation.
· Prepare, analyze and distribute various MIS reports on HR metrics to business leaders to ensure expectations are met, and to evaluate HR team effectiveness.
· Initiated “We Care” open forum for employee’s grievances and issues.
· Was involved in the redesigning of the Compensation Structure.
· Oversee the Regulatory activities impacting the India entity including ensuring that any tax, employment / labour laws, immigration, Regulatory remuneration changes are all complied with.

HR Effectiveness & Digitization
· Implemented Live HR Dashboards instead of regular MIS reporting to the leadership teams.
· Conceptualized and implemented a standby HRIS till Oracle HRMS module was implemented.
· Developed a digitized tool for Evaluation of GET’s as per the company’s values and performance criteria.
· Designed and implemented online tools for effective vendor management
· Conceptualized and implemented Recruitment Score cards and Dashboards, thereby giving visibility to hiring costs and sourcing right talent at the right times and highly reducing recruitment cycle time.
· Took the lead in digitizing existing legacy payroll system and move into a cloud based system for automated Statutory MIS reporting and employee personal data handling

Change Management & Organizational Development
· Acted as a change agent for implementing HR processes for new acquisitions.
· Played an active part in the “Good to Great” team where best practices, EOS evaluations and findings were tracked and monitored.
· Been a POSH committee member for sexual harassment cases and a whistle blower for violations to organizational culture.
· Had restructured the legacy HR team to cater to a wider population by moving into a shared services model primarily for payroll and recruitment.

Industrial Relations
· The India leadership team had identified me as a key resource to be deputed at the manufacturing plant at Kolkata for exposure to IR activities.
· Was responsible for overall activities (canteen, gardens, security, contract labour, etc.) for the manufacturing plants.
· I have had the opportunity to work with unions and take up various IR interventions including reviewing COD and mediate on settlements.

Business HR & Client Relationships
· Engaging with heads of new clients on resource requirement, availability and capability building.
· Held responsibility for settling issues of resources deployed at client locations.
· Ensure the vendors base is adequately qualified and compliant with client requirements.

Project Management & Delivery
· Have managed and led teams while working with multiple stakeholders across the globe till final delivery on various HR digitization and compensation projects.

Strategic HR
· Played key role effectively developing implementing the local strategies for HR interventions as driven by the global policy deployment criteria for resource and talent management.
· Also was involved in advising and recommending the management team on action plans for employee satisfaction and retention of key rated employees.

Legal & Compliance
· Investigating integrity, harassment issues.
· Development and review of statement of work and agreements & contracts for clients / vendors / sub-contractors etc.
· Issue of general / showcause notices as needed (absconding employees, vendor compliance etc.)
· Legal Advisory to the Management team.

Global & Corporate Team Nexus
· Have travelled globally for HR Conferences to meet HR leaders of various countries, and have worked with global corporate teams on consolidating, Headcounts, Recruitment Status, Compensation and Benefits Benchmarking projects, etc.
· Coordinate with global HR team on weekly basis / updates on HR dashboard analytics, information sharing, best practices implementations, policy deployment, business-specific updates, implementation of global processes and identify risks and opportunities for improvement in the HR function including efficiencies and synergies across global HR teams.
· Worked closely with various country HR teams to also manage global visitors, townhalls and general HR events.


EDUCATIONAL CREDENTIALS
Pursuing LLB ● Corporate Law and Intellectual Property, ● RML College of Law, Bangalore
Master of Business Administration ● Human Resources (Major) & Marketing, ● Garden City College, Bangalore – 2004
Bachelor of Engineering ● Mechanical Engineering, ● DSCE, Bangalore – 2001

Description:
ROC Partner Settlement allows operators to quickly and accurately settle charges with their network and content partners. It helps operators improve efficiency through light touch and automation, accurate billing and settlement and prudent accrual provisioning. Catering to the need for visibility of each deal's impact on an operator's bottom line owing to shrinking margins, the solution provides strong coverage in all areas from order to cash. It enables operators to manage costs and revenues on interconnect and partner agreements with domestic and international operators as well as content partners on a day-to-day, and hour-to-hour basis.




Responsibilities 

· Test and Release management
· Project management and updating the status and health of the project to key stakeholders

Project #2

	Title
	 Unity

	Client
	WIND Italy

	Team Size
	 9 

	Role	    
	 Test Management

	Duration   
	 Feb ’14– Sep’16



Description
The Unity portal provides a comprehensive set of tools on a single integrated platform accessed from single sign on Web GUI. Unity enables the roaming manager to manage all facets of his roaming business, within the scope of the Starhome Mach billing and network roaming product portfolio. It is a cloud-based system, and does not require any IT involvement on the part of the customer. It enables the roaming manager to make effective and informed decisions to optimize roaming strategies, and measure their impact on roaming revenue streams. It provides real-time notification options to inform and alert users of changes and trends, in particular avoiding long delays between a system alert and the corresponding user action. The user can configure categorized notifications and alerts that appear on the home page of the Unity portal. In addition, the user can configure SMS, voice and email notifications to groups of users.

Responsibilities 

· Support System testing and UAT testing
· Management of the testing team in delivering quality product in time
· Point of contact for Production issues

 This project involves test case coverage enhancement of various prioritized business critical applications and identifying a proprietary framework which would be customized to best suit MACH’s requirements.
This Project involves automation of identified business critical test cases through OpKey framework, customized Test Execution Reports, complete Integration with QC/Jira, Automatic defect registering into QC/Jira etc

	 Least Cost Routing

	Client
	 Tele2 Sweden

	Team Size
	 7

	Role	    
	 Software Testing

	Duration   
	 Jan ’10 –Dec’11



Description
Least Cost Routing is one of the business tools the commercial owners need to have to make sure that the traffic is routed via the correct long-distance carriers. In other words, the outcome of Least Cost Routing should be that they have an automated tool that suggests the optimal routes for the international traffic for operators. The optimal route is dependent on different factors like the minute price for the destination, agreed discounts (like step pricing, back to the first minute discount) or Volume Commitments, quality of a certain route and Exchange rates 

Responsibilities 
· Participating in the design meetings.
· Performing system, performance and regression testing for cost based and trading reports.
· Giving demo to the Product owners and Support during UAT


Project #5

	Title
	  Roaming Margin Analysis 

	Client
	 Tele2 Sweden 

	Team Size
	 4

	Role
	Software Testing

	Duration   
	 Feb ’09 –Jan ‘10



Description
Roaming margin analysis is a new product to find the correlation of the roaming (TAP) CDR with the interconnect CDR. For an MTC in an outbound roaming scenario, if HPMN is an IC client then   the IC outgoing leg is correlated with the TAP-in CDR. This allows to attribute the IC cost to a certain roaming partner. In case of inbound roaming MOC, we can correlate the IC outgoing leg with the TAP-out CDR.

	Project Summary
	Field Operations Systems (FOS) is developing a new system (ROADS) to support station route planning and real-time route optimization for domestic express ground operations. Territories 2 (T2) designates the portion of the ROADS project that supports route planning, including the use of map manipulation tools. This system will need to obtain data derived from the Customer Sector List on the mainframe.  This data will be used by route planning personnel to effect address disbursement alterations in the sectors.  

Introduction:     
ROADS  (Route Operations and Decision Support)  is a new planning tool being developed by Field Operations Systems (FOS) in phased manner  to accomplish the goals of on-road productivity targets of US Ground Operations . This will support station route planning and real-time route optimization for domestic express ground operations. 

 The Software Architecture Specification for ROADS project gives the high level technical Architectural overview of the application in terms of software and hardware technologies used in its development. It defines and details the significant architecture specific goals of the project.

It also outlines the technologies and frameworks that roads will utilize in broad collaboration and participation of different applications in distributed network.     

SYSTEM OBJECTIVE:
The project is being designed and developed on J2ee framework. The system objective is to develop a robust, multi tiered, reusable, scalable and secure web based architecture. With each layer identified clearly and defined to include specific task of achieving the desired results. 	Project Summary
	· FedEx has tied up with various Global Service Partners (GSPs). The GSPs exchange manifests required for customs clearance with the FedEx server. GRASPWin application allows GSP personnel to receive inbound manifests from FedEx and to send outbound manifests and POD/DEX scans to FedEx. The software also helps keep track of items in the cage and produce various reports.
· FedEx has engaged Wipro to re-engineer GRASP Win v3.1.7 (termed as the base line version of GRASP) in Microsoft .NET 2.0 environment using C# as the language of choice. 
· Certain functionalities of the base line GRASP are no longer required. At the same time, there is a need to include new functionalities into the software to meet the business requirements.
· The base line GRASP, developed in older versions Uniface and Sybase SQL Anywhere environment, has evolved over several years, posing maintenance and enhancement challenges. At the same time, there is a need to bring GRASP on the same platform as other projects at FedEx EMEA.
· Wipro proposes to re-engineer the base line GRASP in Microsoft .NET 2.0 environment using C#. The new, .NET version of GRASP will be termed as GRASP.NET v1.

Job Profile   

 1. Financial Accounts 

 a) Working in ERP & SAP environment, Handling Financial Accounting i.e. Purchase 
  Book, Cash Book, Bank Book, Inventory Accounting, and Sales Accounting 
  etc. 

 b) Assisted in Preparation of Profit & Loss statements, Balance Sheet and related

c) Liaison with Bank for obtaining necessary Bank Certificates.

HR Senior Management Profile

Synopsis: 

· Result oriented senior management professional with 17 years of versatile experience across diverse organizational domains.
· HR Process Transformation and Digitalization. Skilled in designing & implementation of Oracle HCM & end user, excellent customer facing skills, Problem solving, designing of HR operations process, designing/ planning & monitoring of organizational wide HR-Standard Operating Procedures.
· Proven ability in creating & presenting monthly reports, timely & efficient closure of HR operations, timely & accurate payroll processing, maintaining employee database & MIS, HRMS enhancement & maintenance and design/ implementation of Corporate HR programs (Shared Purchase plan, Bonus schemes, People Survey, Rewards & Recognition Policies & Programs, Incentives and PMS).
· Well versed in employee recruitment & retention, staff development, mediation, conflict resolution, benefits & compensation, HR records management, HR policies development and compliance.
· Possess good knowledge of Compensation & Rewards Management, Employee Relations, Training & Development and Organizational Change Management.

Core Competencies:


· Digital HR
· HR/ Recruitment Management
· Policy Implementation/ Compliance
· Workshop & Orientation Program Management
· General Office Administration & Facilities Management
· Performance Management
· Reporting & Documentation
· Training & Development
· Cross Functional Team Coordination



Professional Experience

Apollo Hospitals, Chennai
Deputy General Manager – HR, JUL 2013 till date

Leading the HR function for the Flagship Unit. Play a pivotal key role in driving HR Management across 2500 on roll employees and 2000 contract employees based out of Chennai office.  
· Team Size: 10 member team

Awards & Accolades Won:

· Asia's Best Employer Branding Awards for Women at Work Leadership Award – Aug 2017
· Global HR Excellence Awards for Award for Managing Health at Work & Excellence in HR through Technology – Feb 2017
· National Award Excellence by CMO for Best HR Practices in Health Care Industry 2016
· Early Adopter – Oracle HCM - YOU-R-HR – 2016
· CII - People Excellence Award 2015
· Great Place to Work by Gallup - 2014
· 21st Global HR Excellence Awards 2013 for “Institution Building”.
· 7th Employer Branding Awards 2013 for “Talent Management” and “Best HR Strategy in line with Business”.

OBJECTIVE
Seeking a challenging position as .Net Developer/Tech Lead in Microsoft .Net technology in order to contribute advanced technical skills and knowledge as software professional and add value to the organization.

PROFESSIONAL PROFILE

Microsoft .Net Developer with 10.5+ years of experience in Software Development in Windows and Web-based Applications using Asp.Net, VB.Net, C#, JavaScript, HTML, Telerik, Web Services, WCF, Web API, SSRS, Crystal Reports and SQL Server. I have experience with large MNC’s such as Eli Research, Pitney Bowes, Data World and Porteck India.  More than 8+ of experience with Canadian & US organizations/clients including AAPC, UPS, FedEx, USPS, Purolator, Canada Postal Service & CanPar.

TECHNICAL SKILLS

CAREER HISTORY

Skilliantech India Pvt. Ltd.  (http://www.skilliantech.com) 	 	 
Project: Enterprise Application Group (https://www.Genpact.com/)
EAG is the internal team of Genpact that manages its in house application in Java, MS and SharePoint.  I am the part of MS Tech team that takes care of different applications in web and windows application.  There are nearly 10+ applications, which includes Timesheet Management, Project Management, Deals Management, Duplicate Audit Tool, Virtual Printer etc.   
Environment: 
Asp.Net, C#, VB.Net, SQL Server, Web Services, WCF, JavaScript, SSRS.

· Dot Net Developer | June 2015 – Feb 2017							
Eli Research India Pvt. Ltd. (http://www.eliindia.com) 	 	 
Project: Phoenix/AAPC   (https://www.aapc.com/)
Phoenix/AAPC are the Windows and Web based Healthcare applications used by customer service as well as users for Medical Certifications, to access online courses, purchase online books, pay online course fees and get information/queries related to certification.  Currently around 0.15 million members are using this application. 
Key Accomplishments:
· Successfully delivered 3 phases of AAPC Coder releases within the scheduled time which increases the revenue to a great extends.
· Delivered the Premium Membership bundle release within tight deadline which will help the customers who are interested in webinar and membership together.  
· Worked on the web API issues to fix, test and release it within 15 days with some extended features, without compromising quality and saving substantial revenue for the organization, as the functionality impacts business, with hundreds of users registering themselves daily.
· Completed the code review, fixed issues and unit tested the functionality of shipping label printing application within 4 weeks in order to be executed in Sep-Dec, to ship backordered products.
Environment: 
Asp.Net, C#, SQL Server, Web API, Entity Framework, JavaScript, Telerik, Fogbugz, Jira, Confluence, Salesforce, NuGet Packages, SSRS, GIT & TFS. 

· Technology Lead | May 2014 – June 2015   				               	
Data World Information Systems Pvt. Ltd. (http://www.dataworld.co.in)   		 
Project: PTMS (Property Tax Management System)  	            					 
PTMS is a property and municipality tax calculation application for six municipalities that incorporates property tax collection, widening of tax base and computerization of property taxes for a financial year.  Currently this application handles more than 20 thousands properties for each city.

Key Accomplishments: 
· Completed the Tax Assessment and Tax Demand modules within 2 weeks for a specific city so that it will be presented to the client for demo.   Application will be used by more than 20-30 thousand users who can view, raise issues related to their taxes/property and pay their taxes online. 
· Integrated the web service of the tax calculation with PTMS application so that Assessment and Demand related information is accessible easily by 20-30 thousand citizens and enable them to pay their taxes within a scheduled time.
Environment: 
Asp.Net, C#, SQL Server, XML, JavaScript, Web Services, WCF, HTML, Solr, Bootstrap & SVN

Project: MoUD Tax Calculator  								 
Application calculates the property tax, generates PDF of predefined formats for a specific city based on sets of rules.  The rules are incorporated for six municipalities.    

Key Accomplishments:
· Developed and designed the Tax Calculator for Nagpur city for new Assessment rules within 15 days so that existing and new rules can be compared and presented to client enabling the client to make a decision regarding which rules to implement.
· Wrote a web service in a short time frame to calculate the tax calculation for 20-30 thousand properties and saved it in pdf and excel formats for further processing and analysing.
Environment: 
Asp.Net, C#, SQL Server, XML, Web Services, WCF, HTML & SVN

· Sr. Software Engineer | September 2008 – April 2014			 	
Pitney Bowes Software (http://www.pb.com)			            
Project: Ascent (Shipping Software Solution)	
Ascent is a shipping software solution product that selects the right carrier for one's need, which provides electronic connectivity using multiple carriers, including UPS, USPS, Purolator, FedEx, DHL, CPR & CPC. This Product is more than 15 years old and is used by more than 10,000 customers across US and Canada.  Application generates more than 60+ millions revenue each year.

Key Accomplishments:
· Developed 5 year UPS business rules that gave their 4K+ customers and client to run their business with latest updates within 6 months.
· Implemented Purolator business rules which was very complex and released by us as 2nd customer to Purolator.  Was delivered to the customers 2 weeks prior to the scheduled time.
   Environment: 
   Asp.Net, C#, SQL Server, Web Services, WCF, HTML, Visual FoxPro & Crystal Reports XI R2

· Software Developer | February 2008 – September 2008
Porteck India Infoservices Pvt. Ltd, Noida (http://www.porteck.com)
Project: PARCS (Porteck Account Receivable and Claims Workflow Solution)			
This application is based on the Account Receivable & Medical Claims in the US which is handled by the Diagnostic Centre.  The Centre runs in four regions in the US and this manages 3 different functionalities of the business i.e. Follow-up, Admin and Missing Media (Billing System).
Key Accomplishments:
· Developed new search functionalities for the members based on several permutations and combinations within 2 weeks. 
· Developed several reports for the admin dashboard within 1 month so that the management have a bigger picture about the revenue and claim status and can make appropriate decisions. 
Environment:

WORK EXPERIENCE

· Bagged Bravo Instant Recognition Award from the management in Apr’14 for coordinating performance appraisal with management in emergency leave of HR without any delay in account closure/ affecting regular operations and received appreciation in their words "for the dedication to work beyond the call of duty, unswerving commitment to the organization, cheerfully taking added responsibilities and completing tasks on time, I am pleased to announce ...." 
· Actively convinced the management for implementation of "search for resources in Job portals" instead of outsourcing and in the first attempt on trial version (where we spent Rs. 2,400/-) and recruited 5 candidates successfully which resulted in a cost saving of more than Rs 2,00,000/-
· Secured appreciation from Director of the company for resolving contingent liability of Rs. 56 Lakhs in coordination with auditor for compiling documents and winning the case against Sales Tax Department
· Compiled documentation for availing service tax refund and was awarded Kaizan 

· Accountable for posting, documentation & safeguarding all of the financial records (Soft/ hard) for Indian entity

PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL PROFILE: 
A Post Graduate in Human Resource Management with 9.5 years’ experience in the field of Human 
Resource. Excellent knowledge in MS Office Word, Excel, and Power Point With strong interpersonal 
skills and ability to establish and maintain effective working relations with people in a multi-cultural, 
multi ethnic environment. Ability to work under pressure, own initiative or as part of a team, with an 
outstanding record of achieving set goals. 
Knowledge of Human Resource Management, Industrial Relation, Training & development, 
Statutory Compliance, Performance Management System, Employee Engagement etc.          
     
PROFESSIONAL SNAPSHOT 

 
1) TOFFLON (INDIA) PRIVATE LIMITED., J P NAGAR AREA, BANGALORE 

 
 Tofflon (India) Private Ltd. Bangalore India, is a subsidiary of Shanghai Tofflon Science and 

Technology Co., Ltd. China.  Have the marked presence in pharmaceutical and biotechnology 
companies across India. Our consistent efforts have developed strong business bonding with more 
than 100 clients. Our vigorous business expansions lead us towards successful diversification in 
various segments of pharmaceutical industry like formulation, API & Injectable etc. Tofflon has 
established joint ventures and partnerships with the top quality companies like Kyowac (Japan), 
Airex (Japan), and Top System (Japan), Praxair (USA). 
 

       Role                     :   Assistant Manager –HR & Admin (Reporting to HR Head) 
       Duration               :   September -2013 to till date. 
       Workforce             :   45  
 
Responsibilities: 

 
Recruitment & Induction: 

 Responsible for entire process of recruitment from sourcing to induction.  
 

Learning & Development 
 Scheduling training programs based on - Education, Experience, and Exposure Concept. 
 Conduct Training based on need analysis and generate Training Calendar.  
 

Performance Management: 
 Co-ordinate with departmental heads for conducting annual Performance review of employees 

and release of annual increments.  
 Monitoring employees training / probationary periods and issue of the confirmation letters in 

time. 
Key responsibilities  

 Expat Management (FRRO),  Immigration documentation work 

mailto:jameer.b11@gmail.com


2 of 4 

 Handing Import and export documentation work

 Customs Clarence from the agency   
 HR & Administration Policies Manual – SOP 

Statutory Compliance: 
 Handing Board meeting work

 EPF registration and monthly returns from agency  
 Updating all the statutory registers and filing of returns. 
 Ensuring timely compliance of statutory requirements. 
 Payroll process with Excel spread sheet. 

 
Administration: 
 
Canteen: 

 To supervise and maintain the stock of necessary food items and utensils grocery etc. 
 Ensure and arrange to supply hygienic food to the employees.  

Guest House: 
 Supervision and good housekeeping of guest house. 
 Providing accommodation to employees and guests. 
 Renewals of Guest house lease / rent agreements and arranging payments. 

Vehicle Arrangement: 
 Arranging vehicles for in-house and outside employees as per requirements. 
 Inspection of vehicle documents. 
 Releasing of payments for hired vehicles. 

General Administration: 
 Entire time office function. 
 Organizing events and tours for employees  
 Public relations. 
 Vendor Management. 
 Office Stationery Management  
 Employee engagement activities.  
 Admin Expense Analysis  
 Strong Co-ordination and negotiation skill. 
 Follow-up for invoices from the supplied vendors.  
 Renewals of Guest house lease / rent agreements and arranging payments. 

2)  SUZLON ENERGY LTD, Bangalore 
Suzlon Gujarat Wind Park Ltd. wholly owned company of Suzlon Energy Ltd. SGWPL is mainly 
engaged in Power Infrastructure Planning, Development and power generation. And is one among the 
top three companies, in the field of wind energy power generation in the world. 
 
Achievements at Suzlon: Supported to the project team to Execute of 240MW in Karnataka 
successfully for installing (1.25,1.5 & 2.1MW of wind turbines) in the year 2009-2011 at Suzlon. 
 

ROLE  :  Sr. Executive HR & Admin (Reporting to  Manager-HR & Admin) 
Duration        :  Feb 2008 to March 2013 
Workforce      :  150  



3 of 4 

 
Responsibilities 
 

Human Resource Planning: 
 Planning man power resources in consultation with HOD’s as per business requirement to 

ensure support to business in meeting goals. 
 Tracking department wise no. of existing employees, new employees and replacements.  
 Conducting quarterly wise man power audit. 
 Maintaining of Organization Chart with structure of employees. 
 Preparation of JD’S for the vacancies. 
 

Recruitment & Exit Formalities 
 Sourcing candidates from portals, references, & scheduling interviews. 

 Conducting the Preliminary Screening and short-listing on the basis of the requirement. 

 Conducting initial tests (Communication, , Computer applications Knowledge & subject 
Knowledge) 

 Preparing the Offer for the proposed hire with reference to the internal parity, education, 
experience and job responsibility. Explaining the proposed salary to the candidate, and closing 
the offer  

 Organizing   Walk-ins. 
 Campus recruitment. 
 Undertaking  new-joining formalities. Issuing induction plan for all new-joiners and initiating 

all related internal communications such as welcome notes.   
 Organizing Induction Programme to new joinees in co ordination with L&D centre.  
 Taking exit interviews and updating with reasons of leaving the organization. 
 To make sure the employee has completed all the formalities like filling up of Exit Interview 

Form and no due form. 
 

Learning & Development 
 Handling the process of TNI – Training Need Identification through Developing Skill Matrix for 

all categories. 
 Preparation of annual training calendar based on the Gap in skill matrix. 
 Organizing training and development programmes for employees in consultation with L&D 

centre. 
 Handling complete logistics of the training programmes – from providing the Feedback Form 

& Attendance Sheets to ensure travel arrangement in case of outdoor sessions 
 Uploading the Feedback forms and Attendance in SAP. 
 Evaluating the effectiveness of the training programme. 

           
Contract Labour Management 

 Maintenance of Records as Principal Employer 
 Ensure the statutory compliance by contractors under Contract Labour Act by preparing the 

checklist. 
 Monthly/Quarterly/yearly returns Under Contract Labour Act. 
 Liaison with Labor Department 

 
Employee Engagements 

 Birthday Celebrations. 
 Arranging Picnic to the employees.

 Employee of the month. 
 Marriage day celebrations. 

 
PMS Process

ADITI BANERJEE SHAW 

 Mobile: +919004002076  E-Mail ID: aditibaner11@gmail.com 
 

CAREER SUMMARY 

Corporate HR professional adept at creating dynamic world-class HR systems and processes through employee 
engagement and intrapreneurship. Capability building champion proficient at driving a culture of innovation 
and recognition by facilitating cross-industry best practices and empowerment. Empathic manager skilled at 
improving employee lifecycle by aligning employee and organizational vision contributing to greater revenues.  

HR COMPETENCIES 

    Employee Engagement 
    Performance Management  

    HR Policies & Procedures 

 Capability Building 
 Organizational Development 

 Compliance Management 

 Talent Management 
 Career Management 

 Manpower Planning  

 PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 

Cipla Ltd. as Senior Manager, Business Partner HR                                          Aug ’16 – Present 
Previously managing HR responsibilities for entire Maharashtra & Goa. Currently managing Sikkim Plant. 

 Created high levels of employee engagement through MiVoice, a pioneering employee 

engagement tool deployed across Cipla. Used inputs from town-hall sessions & FGDs for creating 

regional level action plans in discussion with HODs & Site Head.  

 Regional PMS implementation and bell-curve designing. 

 Implementing cross-vertical R&R initiatives. 

 Preparing regional HR Dashboards with monthly HR health analytics.  

 Designed new Induction process including evaluation and creation of new job descriptions for 75+ 

key roles across levels & units. 

Plant HR responsibilities 
 Mapped L&D requirements for senior plant management. Currently focusing on implementation. 

 Analyzing & assessing Data Integrity issues and absconding cases for taking administrative action.  

 Building succession pipeline & designing innovative strategies to reduce attrition.  

 Created plant-level HR process and action plan. 

Field HR responsibilities 
 Initiated recruitment drive across India for 200 vacancies in Chronic & Emerging Therapy. Managed 

manpower planning & recruitment including redeployment & systemic and on-ground integration. 

 Shared insights on field-level challenges with senior management based on 20+ joint field-works 

with the medical representatives. 

XLRI – Xavier School of Management as Research Associate (on sabbatical) Jun ’14 – Aug ’14 
Worked with Prof. R.K Premarajan & Prof. L. Gurunathan on an Accenture-sponsored project on “Career 
Pathing the Employees with Disability”. 

 
 



2 

 

Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. (Automobiles) as Manager, Business HR  Feb ’13 – Apr ’14 
Managed 450+ employees including employees at leadership levels, PhDs & Researchers. 5 Depts. 2 Reportees. 

 Employee Engagement: Led the creation of benchmark survey Anubhav implemented across 9 

locations pan-India to assess effectiveness and improve the HRD & Admin connect with employees. 

Resulted in gap identification and substantial changes in a company-wide tool MCares.  Improved 

employee satisfaction level across 5 departments in Auto Sector from 52% to 70% through MCares.  

 

MCares was a comprehensive tool for assessing the employee engagement level across 5 categories 

viz, Career, Alignment, Recognition, Empowerment & Strive. Key Outcomes: 

o Career – Increased employee satisfaction score from 33% to 60% within 6 months through 

multiple initiatives including creation of IDPs for 100+ employees and more T&D 

opportunities [classroom training (3 to 6 days), e-learnings (2 to 4), other certifications] 

o Alignment – Aligned goals and responsibilities of 60+ employees leading to higher 

productivity, changed manager feedback cycle from annual to quarterly basis, put 12 

employees through Development Centre training as part of succession planning 

o Recognition – Arranged a project on Reward-Recognition. Interviewed and analyzed data for 

600+ employees at all levels resulting in creation of a company-first 360° appreciation system 

o Empowerment – Improved stakeholder engagement by devolving decision-making process 

for budgeting & procurement from Departmental Heads to Managers across all 5 departments. 

o Strive – Addressed work-life balance issues through creation of gym facilities, better company 

transport facilities for employees leaving late and improved canteen facilities.  

 Culture Building: Multiple discussions with top executives on work life balance, diversity of gender 

& culture, career & succession planning, planned hiring based on skill mapping, creating a culture of 

360° appreciation etc. Designed role play assessment for mid-year & annual reviews of GETs. 

 Capability Building: Conducted 4 behavioural training sessions for 50+ employees resulting in 

improved employee presentation & communication skills for interaction with various stakeholders. 

 Performance Management: Resolved performance rating issues during mid-year appraisals (60+) 

& annual appraisals (20+) and turned around 3 resignation cases of high performance employees.  

 Manpower Planning: Built organisation structure for 5 departments for resource and budget 

management. 

 CSR: Led a CSR drive for NGO visits to Chennai for 30+ women employees and 5 tree plantation 

drives involving company Chairman, President and 100+ employees. 

Infosys Limited as Associate Lead, Business Partner (HRD)    Jun ’10 – Jan ’13 
Managed 500+ employees for a Business Unit. Handled employee career management, performance 

management & retention, policies, compensation & benefits and project allocation. 

 Employee Engagement: Created a high performance culture through 12 quarterly events & 3 
annual events on Reward & Recognition. Improved organization-wide communication channels 
through 4 Management-employee meets in one year. Created an interactive culture through 3 mob 
dance programs & 10+ cultural festivals in the development centre. Conducted 70+ HR engagement 
meets resulting in closure of 100+ cases of employee business queries. Initiated Buddy program 
for new employees resulting in greater employee engagement. 

 Performance Management: Enabled substantial revenue increase for a Business Unit resulting in a 
pan-India headcount increase from 700 to 10k within a year. Trained 200+ in goal setting and PMS 
which led to creation of top performers who contributed to the revenue increase. Created an 
effective 360° feedback mechanism by enhancing existing Comparative Relative Ranking process. 



3 

 

 Succession Planning: Nominated 23 high performance employees to the Infosys Leadership 
Institute resulting in conversion to 3 GM and 2 DM positions.  

 Competition Analysis: Conducted 25+ pre-exit interviews resulting in a deeper understanding of 
competition salaries (average hike of 40-50% per employee). 

 Compliance Expert: Handled 60+ issues around abscondence behavior and data abuse. 
 Employee Fitment assessment through review of 275+ employees based on their PMS ratings for 3 

consecutive FYs (all employees reviewed had gone through a 6-month PIP training) 
 Resolved various personal & professional issues for 50+ employees through coaching & counselling. 

 
Wipro Technologies as Senior Executive, Talent Acquisition Division               Jun ’08 – May ’10 

Handled entire Recruitment Process (lateral & campus) for Eastern region. 

 SPOC for Kolkata: Recruited 300+ employees over a period of 2 years for 5 Business Units. 
 Campus Recruitment Expert: 10+ presentations in 20 campuses across India including IITs, NITs & 

ICAI Kolkata. Was deputed on a special 4-month project to Pune for hiring 150+ candidates. 
 Garnered 450+ applications (highest from the region) as WASE (Wipro Academy of Software 

Excellence) Champion for East across 3 states covering 40+ colleges for recruiting B.Sc. graduates. 
 Conducted a pan-India Market Research for competition analysis on super skill sets which helped 

Wipro allocate skill-specific recruitment personnel. 
 

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION  

 MBA with First Class (2008), Institute of Engineering & Management (IEM), Kolkata 

 B.Com. (Honours) with First Class (2004), Shri Shikshayatan College, Kolkata 

 Std. XII (Higher Secondary) with First Division (2001), Loreto Day School, Kolkata 

 Std. X (Madhyamik) with First Division (1999), Loreto Day School, Kolkata 

EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES 

 Participated in various music, dance & drama programmes in school and college. 
 Music:  Completed 4-year course in Nazrul Geeti and 3-year course in Rabindra Sangeet. Was awarded 

Certificate of Sangeet Bhushan Final (1st Division) in both from Pracheen Kala Kendra, Chandigarh. 
 Drawing: Ranked participant in various drawing competitions at local and international levels. 
 Sports: Participated in inter-school throw-ball & badminton competitions. 

SOCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS 

 Led a disaster relief cloth collection drive across 200 flats during Chennai floods liaising with NGO Goonj. 
 Participated in Asha Deep, a workshop organized by Loreto Day School to help poor children with food, 

clothing & education.  
 Awarded Certificate of Appreciation from the Cancer Centre Welfare Home & Research Institute for a 

fundraising effort to support children suffering from cancer. 
 Participated in multiple corporate Social Service Programs for orphans & old-age homes. 

PERSONAL INTERESTS 

 Languages Known: English, Bengali & Hindi (Business proficiency) / Oriya (Elementary proficiency) 

 Software known: MS Office Suite, SAP, PeopleSoft, Synergy (Wipro).                     

 Interests: Dancing, singing, listening to music, sketching, travelling, photography & meditation.

@ Rimini Street ( www.riministreet.com)

@ Google India

Job Profile:

Responsible for the HR tasks, policies, practices and employee issues across the organization. Responsible for providing HR advice and support in line with service level agreements and HR Statutory Compliance.

· Design and implement employee motivation schemes like in Quality competition , workshops etc.
· Maintain data of  employees, generating monthly HR Reports Organizing events, HR activities, Maintaining employee personal file and keeping the record up-to-date, Coordinating for the smooth exit process of resigning employees.
· Prepare relieving letter of the resigned candidates after channel clearance from all departments.

Project Overview:
Hewitt Equipment Limited is the authorized Caterpillar Dealer. The project aims to support/Monitor the Business activities of Client. The functional team will analyze the business flow and create change requests. They will be supported by ABAP consultants to achieve the desired improvement. The optimization happened in Equipment master and Material master. The project also involved reporting in these areas.
RESPONSIBILITIES/DELIVERABLES: 
· Developed and delivered the interactive Report for Account receivable in Finance Module. The Report will display the Output in ALV and place the same in ABAP Directory. 
· Developed a Report in Finance Module to overcome the SAP Standard limitation on FI posting.
· Developed a Report HR Extract Performance Improvement for BI Module.
· Worked Extensively on IDOC Segment Creation, Message Type Creation, Assigning Message type to Function Module and Basic Type, Partner Profile Creation.
· Developed the Inbound IDOC’s for standard Basic type and update the details in standard screen as per the payload from other SAP System.
· Worked on MM Module to update the Confirmation category based on IDOC Payload.
· Developed the Inbound interface in SPROXY with features to update the table entries or to update any other screen per the Payload from SAP System.
· Developed an outbound Proxy to send the details of ECC to other System.
· Developed an Automated tool to collect all the Error IDOC’s and send the list as email to respective Persons on email.
· Worked on Customer exit to validate standard field on Purchase Order Screen in MM Module.
· Worked on User exit to add custom field in Sales order Screen for SD Module.
· Added two fields with search help in equipment Screen for CS Module.  
· Worked on Implicit enhancement to check configuration on Sales order Screen.
· Worked on BADI for Customer Service for TCODE LI21 to add reason codes while clearing differences.
· Worked on Challenging Change Request's like Sales Machine Pricing and helped the Functional team to close 3 Incidents. 
· Apart from Development, having the good experience on Debugging.
· Worked on Ticket tracking tool OCTOPUS.
· Besides ABAP, have a basic knowledge of Material/PO/Sales order creation, Class creation for Material, assigning configuration and values to cross plant materials.

	ABAP Consultant

	Sotreq 

	Location
	Chennai



Project Overview: SAP Implementation for Sotreq 
Sotreq is one of the main dealer of caterpillar. The Project started as an implementation Project and aimed to implement the Business in SAP System. The Functional consultant analyzed the existing Business flow and create the Functional Document with the requirement. The technical team after walkthrough will implement the requirement in SAP System.
RESPONSIBILITIES/DELIVERABLES:

· Analyzed the existing codes and optimize it to improve system performance.

The Scope of this Project is to support the SOP Module (Sales and Operation Planning) which is a custom-build planning solution. It is based on SAP ERP. Henkel is using it for more than 9 years’ now. It is a mighty tool and supports the forecasting and planning on a weekly basis for the business units.

	(DBS Bank (Singapore))

	27 month(s)
	BIP (Business Intelligence Platform)

	 
	Project Description:Business Intelligence Platform is the central repository of data used by different projects and various analytics teams of the bank.

Data are directly sourced from major bank systems and are integrated in a common data layer. BIP’s design philosophy is to make the data reusable across different project implementations and available to different banking users. Using different tools to connect to BIP, different teams are enabled to support MIS, Analytics, and even regulatory reporting requirements. 

The overview of data flow and data transformation from source applications to the different BIP layers then to the downstream marts and views

Process begins where data are extracted from source files and processed in Informatica to handle data type exceptions and to complete other file validations. Data is then loaded to OIA (Operational Image Area) after source key validation for full files or for maintenance of snapshots where incremental data from source is received or for maintaining history, if applicable. Data exceptions are loaded to separate tables for tracking/resolution.

Data from OIA are transformed based on the source-to-target mapping specifications and BMAP/reference table validations to fit into the BIP Common Data Model (CDM) / SIM (Simplified Integrated Model) and to consolidate/apply changes to the CDM/SIM history tables. 

Data from CDM/SIM are extracted and transformed for downstream usage. Transient tables may be utilized to simplify complex transformations. Transformation of target reference values to the business values are also performed in this layer. 

Transformed data from CDM/SIM layer are loaded to downstream target tables for commonly-used information and user-driven requirements.. 

Transformed and untransformed views are made available to downstream users for reporting, analysis, and data mining via different reporting tools such as SAS, Qlikview, BO, etc. 

	 
	Project Contribution:- Data Modelling for 200 + URs ( User Requests)
- Data Modelling for Regionalization Project ( GDW HK to BIP - SG Migration)
- Data Modelling for CDM / SIM, ADM, XTR, CRA DB.
- Review of Data Mapping Sheets (Prepared by Data Analyst)

The intent of the Retail Data Warehouse programme is to provide an EDW which has data elements from Core and Non Core systems. The data delivered from this programme will be the key resource which will enable RBSG to manage Customer Value and enable to base strategic and tactical decisions on complete, accurate, and timely information.

The Document had 5 major sections as listed below.

	Project Description:Teradata to Netezza Migration PoC:

Vodafone has built its Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Platform on Teradata. Over the years it has grown to multi–terabyte. Currently they have EDW in multiple generation of hardware and older version of software component. The EDW has grown so much that it has become a bottleneck for delivering new analytical and data mining analysis. The data latency has become a major challenge. Vodafone EDW has reached a “Add more Node” cycle. This resulted in all projects like SMART sourcing data from OSS/BSS layers directly, instead of EDW. IBM has proposed the solution to re platform the EDW on Netezza 1000 72 model, with DataStage as ETL tool.

- Understanding the existing Data Flow and Data Model , Architecture
- Redesigning the architecture(Dimensional Model, ETL,OLAP)
- Documenting the solution
- Interfacing with the whole team

 

	08/2004 - 02/2005
	British Petrolium - Energy & Utility Major, UK

	7 month(s)
	LPG Consulting

	 
	Project Description: 
This is one of the world's largest energy companies, providing its customers with fuel for transportation, energy for heat and light, retail services and petrochemicals products for everyday items. BP has grown from a local oil company into a global energy group; employing over 100,000 people and operating in over 100 countries worldwide.

British Petroleum LPG project started as a Define Phase in the 3rd week of September 2004. The previous vendors (Quinnox and TAH) had built a data warehouse system for BP where Oracle, Informatica, Kalido and BO have been used. The system is in place for Netherlands. Now BP wants us to recommend system architecture enhancements and give implementation designs to carry out the changes we recommend, so that the present reports run better. This includes tuning of multi-CPU database servers, queries in the reports.

	 
	Project Contribution:
- Understanding the Business Need
- Analysis of As-Is Architecture
- Proposing new architecture(To-Be)
- Providing the cost/benefit analysis report & Implementation.

 

	06/2002 - 12/2004
	GE - Power System

	31 month(s)
	GE Power System global Data warehousing

	 
	Project Description: 
This Global Data warehouse for GE Power System is the single largest data warehousing system developed to fulfill the analytical needs of all customers across GEPS.

It was built using Ralph Kimbal's methodology for different subject areas in the supply chain management cycle and manufacturing. This includes Engineering, Finance, Inventory, Manufacturing, Order Mgmt, Purchasing, budgeting, estimation etc.

	 
	Project Contribution:
- Data Marts modeling (STAR Schema/BUS Architecture) using Erwin
- Back room services design 
- Interfacing with OLAP and ETL Leads
- Single point contact for every Data Mart.


 

	02/2000 - 04/2002
	IFCI Limited - India

	27 month(s)
	Integrated Asset Liability Management System

	 
	Project Description: 
IFCI Limited (formerly known as Industrial Finance Corporation of India) with its Head Office at New Delhi, is one of the premier term lending institutions in India, which is promoting industrial development in India by providing medium term, and long-term asset based finance. Satyam Computers developed an Integrated Asset & Liability Management System (IALMS) consisting of five (5) modules covering the areas of Resource Raising, Investments and Dis-Investments, Treasury, Foreign Currency and ALM (Asset Liability Management). 
tion.

	 
	Project Contribution:
- Effective client communication 
- Requirements analysis 
- Translation of requirements into technical specification
- Data Base Design
- Code Review in PL/SQL, Oracle Forms and Reports
- Integration and unit testing
- Executed and delivered the module successfully

 

	06/1999 - 01/2000
	ICC (Internal Competency Center of Satyam Computer Services Limited)

	8 month(s)
	Fixed Asset management System

	 
	Project Description: 
FMS was developed as a model Fixed Asset Management system, based on the functionality and requirements of a premier bank in the Gulf, as well as some Indian wholesale banks. Since Fixed Assets like Land, Buildings, Furniture, Fixtures, Machinery, Office equipment, Vehicles and so on, are used only indirectly in the banking business and not for selling or converting into liquid assets, their acquisition and management has to be controlled more effectively. 
The FMS system gives complete purchase information, location, quantity, life of all fixed assets, rate of depreciation, method of depreciation and disposal details. The assets can be revalued annually and all historic data is maintained for the entire life cycle of each asset. 
The FMS provides accountability for each fixed asset. It helps visualize the assets in different categories, maintain purchase and sales details, depreciation info and various MIS reports. 

	 
	Project Contribution:
- Analysis of the requirement 
- Coding as per the guidelines and templates
- Preparation of test cases and tested (Unit Level) the module as per the quality standard
- Optimized the product before delivery

 

	02/1999 - 06/1999
	

	5 month(s)
	Cash Register System

	 
	Project Description: The scope of the project was to develop a Cash Register System, which caters to the specific requirements of Bahrain Telecommunications, or BATELCO. The application provided the functionality for sales, inventory, payment and administration.

The functionality of the system included: 
- Collection of Telephone bills 
- Collection of Service Deposits 
- Collection of Other Charges 
- Sale of Pre-paid cards. 
- Collection of Final Settlement Bills 
- Selling of Items 
- Maintenance of Inventory 
- Stock transfers, issues, receipts 

The system provided the interfacing software to different devices like scanner/Bar Code reader, MICR reader, slip printer, Receipt Printer and display unit using OPOS interface. The system also provided a single window solution to service center front-end operations with ease of operations and up-to-date on-line information about the stock position, pending bills for collection and sales. 

	 
	Project Contribution:- Analyzed the specifications provided by the clients
- Designed the system 
- Coding
- Prepared Unit Test Plans and Unit test cases

 

	11/1998 - 02/1999
	

	4 month(s)
	Account Master Migration (AM)

	 
	Project Description: 
AM Project is a migration project, which involves migration from IDMS Network database to DB2 Relational database. The goal of this project is to have applications that are currently retrieving data from IDMS Account Master database and convert them to retrieve the same data from DB2 Account Master database.

	 
	Project Contribution:
- Requirement analysis
- Design and coding
- Unit Testing


 

	06/1998 - 11/1998
	GE Global Consumer Finance

	6 month(s)
	Global Receivables Integration Project (GRIP)

	 
	Project Description: 
This is a customization project for GE-GCF. GE had acquired a credit card product VISION PLUS from PAYSYS. This product has been customized to suit the requirement of various countries. The VISION PLUS package uses CICS, VS COBOL II & VSAM.

	 
	Project Contribution:- Requirements Analysis
- Coding
- Unit & System Testing.
- Daily Job Runs.

This law provides an entitlement of up to 12 weeks of job-protected, unpaid leave during any 12-month period to eligible, covered employees. Apart from this FMLA there are around 40 different leave plan types in various states of USA. TAM is an automated information system for tracking employee leaves and absence. Maintaining a history of each participant (employee). TAM assists large, mid-sized and small companies to track their employee related absence and leave plans. TAM provides support to all the above mentioned companies in managing and supporting their productivity measurements.

· Merit of working on development and support projects for:
· Barclay Bank, (Mainframe, Oracle, Web Technologies), USA
· Vodafone, UK.
Jun’05–Sep’09: Firstsource Solutions Ltd., Bangalore as Project Manager and Program Manager

Steered software development for Relay Health account as an Offshore Business Unit Head managing $0.7 Mn business (for year); led large teams (50+ team in RelayHealth Account) for successfully delivering tough SLA norms in development and support engagements with an attrition below 1%
· Managing and Clinical ERP (Sunrise Acute) CPOE Implementation in various US Hospitals, T-System Account as an Offshore Account Manager and achieved business growth from $0.5 Mn (Year)
· Improvised client satisfaction through efficient management of SLA almost by 97%
· Boosted business growth by around 90% in billable hours & headcount, by strategically developing business relations; also utilised business support capabilities for supporting engagement in the key accounts.
Feb’10–Mar’14: Omega Healthcare P Ltd, Bangalore as Deputy General Manager – Software Development

· Spearheading a gamut of tasks as India Head of Delivery Software Development, administering a team of 75 plus staff (new set-up), development, implementation and supporting applications within the SLA agreement and developing projects as part of Divestiture releases
· Collaborating with business partners across organization to identify opportunities and drive growth 
· Key driver of development and delivery of software solutions to meet customer needs 
· Mapping & executing business process improvements related to technical applications, systems and client implementations
· Representing company's software development expertise in winning of new business along with sales department 
· Liaising with senior leadership across organization & stimulating resource allocation as per business objectives
· Negotiating and managing critical vendor relationships to maximize value and timeliness of external innovations
· Assuring that propounded new features and capabilities integrated into existing networks using company current and future network technologies
· Identifying and investigating advanced technologies offering company significant technical and financial benefits
Mar’14 – June’15: Global RCP, Bangalore as Director Technology – Software Development

· Worked as Cloud(web) Based PM (Practice Management) and EMR product development & providing end to end solutions, also working with various product integration solutions, using HL7, REST API, JSON, FHIR and etc.
· Worked in AWS solution & architecture (Distributed and scalable AWS cloud solutions)
· Providing end to end to enterprise solution architecture and design.
· Representing company's software development expertise in winning of new business along with sales department 
· Liaising with senior leadership across organization & stimulating resource allocation as per business objectives
· Negotiating and managing critical vendor relationships to maximize value and timeliness of external innovations
· Assuring that propounded new features and capabilities integrated into existing networks using company current and future network technologies.
· Development Methodologies: Agile software development.
· Tracking tools: JIRA and trello Board.
· Leading 70 plus members of software engineers through the full software development cycle, delivering high quality systems on time that satisfy customer’s requirement. Also working with Principal SDEs and software leaders both internal and external of the organization to drive sound technical decisions across teams also hiring, mentoring and managing a highly skilled set of Software Development Engineers and Managers, managing them to deliver and growing their careers. 
Highlights:
· Taking additional responsibilities to interact with Eyecare Leaders team to providing integrated solutions to develop a common platform all bundled products as a single product.
· Also providing cost benefit solutions in enterprise level.
Sr Technical Project Manager – Software Development (Analytics -Product Development, Integrations & Implementation)
July’15 – May’2018: Eli Global, as Sr Technical Project Manager – Software Development (Analytics -Product Development, Integrations & Implementation)

· Skills in envisioning usage of new technology and tailoring its usage for achieving desired results; distinction of implementing project management processes; well conversant with scope and schedule management for application development in conjunction with annual budgets and IT strategy

· Pioneered critical programs & quality initiatives, involved in process transitions with notable success in directing a broad range of IT initiatives while participating in yearly planning, analysis & implementation of solutions 

· ISO – Implementation: As per of Internal and External auditor / Auditee to successfully implemented for HiTRUST, ISO 9001-2015, 27001,

· Drove change, infused new ideas, challenged status quo, standardised / processes and elevated the performance to the next level; ensured that the centre delivered value beyond cost arbitrage; excelled at turnaround management: efficiently managed business growth from $0.25Mn (year) for Medistreams Account and business growth from $0.3Mn (Year) form various other accounts
· Strong Domain Knowledge, In Medical Coding, Medical Manager, CPC, CPT, ICD 9 /10, Payment posting, Patient Demographic, claim process, correspondence and AR.
Eli Global as a Sr. Technical Project Manager in Software Development
18 plus years of experience in driving overall IT Projects & Delivery Management in and Healthcare

· Offering over 18 plus years of experience in driving overall IT Projects & Delivery Management in and Healthcare (Payer and Provider) Banking, Insurance and Telecom domains
· Worked with Eli Global as a Sr. Technical Project Manager in Software Development
· Pioneered at planning, building & delivering IT Applications at the enterprise scale involving selection of appropriate technology & products, Enterprise Solution Architect and directing timely completion of product roll-out & projects across multiple platforms & infrastructure.

Role:  Executive-HR 







SSGS is a new breed software concern, committed to catalyzing the competence and competitiveness of its clients by helping them succeed through the power of information technology. It is headquartered in Denmark with its India Development Center in Hyderabad. Driven by the credo that solutions are effective only when organizational needs are accurately ascertained and aptly addressed, it looks upon itself as an integral part of its client's organizations. SSGS approaches development and maintenance through a simplified access to project domains
Area of expertise: 
· Database (HRMS) Updation and maintenance - To maintain the Employee Master Database.
· Developing and maintaining rapport with the employees, listening to their grievances, solving whatever possible at individual level, co-ordination with concerned departments and with next level manager. 
· Delivered and executed end to end solutions in Employee Retention, Employee Engagement Activities.

· Managing HR employee information through systems maintenance ensuring continuous data integrity to high standards and accuracy.

· Tracking of attendance and leaves as per policy & internal SLAs.
· Ensure unambiguous understanding and adherence to all HR policies and processes.

· Ability to balance working within a team environment and independent profile execution. 

· Taking care of the exit formalities with the completion of exit interview process, providing the F&F calculation and ensuring that all relieving documents are handed over to the employee and to see that the process is smoothly closed.

· Create regular and ad hoc reports for the management to facilitate strategic level planning. 

· Recruitment and Selection process.
Responsibilities: Responsible to provide HR Generalist support with respect to all key functions across the organization-

Recruitment Activities:
· Responsible for end to end Recruitment Process.

· Sourcing and screening of the profiles based on the requirement through various web portals, internal and external referrals, and other sources like Yahoo Groups, Business Networking etc.

· Giving the preview about the company and the interview process to the candidates.

· Aligning them to the technical panel for further technical screening and co-ordinating for further process.
Joining Formalities:
· Taking care of joining formalities such as issuing Joining kit, creating Employee ID and personal file, capturing the skills and updating the skill records etc.

· Coordinating and Follow up with Network Team for workstation allocation, system allocation, creation of e-mail/login id etc.

· Sending Welcome mail and Introduction to the BUH and key management for senior candidates.
Induction:
· Coordinating New Hire joinee’s with various departments like System Administration, Finance etc. aligning the employee with the Reporting Manager and introducing to all the concerned.

· Assist employees in understanding Employee Manual/Handbook, Overall benefits and policies & procedures of the company. 
Employee Communication and Support:
· Provide employee support on need basis-Issuing Residence Proofs, provide leave balance on request, addressing employee needs/queries, escalation of business card request to Admin etc.

· Proper communication to all the employees on Organizational happenings.

· Sending circulars to employees for intimation on change in Address and contact information.

· Regular Interaction with the employees, Grievance Handling and escalation to further levels on need basis.

· Maintaining the list of birthdays and sending birthday greetings to the employees.

Focus on Continuous development for maintaining an Employee friendly environment through transparency, regular interaction, cultural activities, Office parties, contests, etc.
Training and Development:
· Co-ordinating with the Training & Development Department for training programs to the newly joined employees on Quarterly basis.

· Participating in the Training programs and feedback analysis..
Exit Formalities:
· Taking care of exit formalities such as issuing Exit Interview Form, Handover & Take over and Clearance Certificate Form to ensure smooth exit process.

· To Initiate De-activation of email/login id, access card control, No Dues Clearance etc.

· Conducting & Analyzing Exit Interviews and updating the feedback in the Exit Database.

· Providing the Full and Final settlement Calculation of the existing employee to the Finance for further process.

· Issuing Experience and Relieving letters.

This free mobile app also present on website provides medical care at the click of a button. This helps you take informed decisions to book your appointment.
